review.reviewBody: Obviously I really like this shoe.  It’s light, durable and, most important, really comfortable.  I use it for both MT biking and gravel riding.
review.name: This is my 4th pair

review.reviewBody:
I've grown to really like these shoes. You've seen them on the feet of numerous riders in any CX World Cup race. This is my second pair. I went down half a size (from 43 to 42.5) and the fit is much better even though they felt a little snug at first. I was a little concerned about mashing my toe on the runs but they're perfectly fine. 

Lightweight, easy to adjust BOA dials, good texture on the sole and rubber where want it under the arch when setting up for dismounts. They fit with minimal slop without having to crank down so hard that your feet hurt. The ability to add toe spikes ensures these are legit race shoes.  

The color may be a bit polarizing but the blue matches my bike accents and team kit. 

A few neg's:
The rubber is VERY grippy. You'd think this a bonus but sometimes you're better off sliding than sticking and risking--or resulting in--injury. 

The soles are full carbon which means lightweight but also that the cleats will move a bit more easily. Make sure to use thread lock and to tighten them the max amount.
review.name: High Performance Race Shoes for CX

review.reviewBody:
Will be returning.

Been wearing 45.5 in Shimano for abour 8 years, can't find this shoe in 45.5 in the US anymore.  Ordered 46.  Fit was suprisingly comfortable in the toe box but noticeably too long and too loose in the heel. Wary of going down to a 45, wondering if the 45Wide is wider in the heel as well or just in the toe box, sadly companies don't seem to disclose too much about their last.  Sole feels really soft and grippy which would be nice for CX in cold muddy terrain or wet rocks but don't expect to get away with these as multi-purpose shoes or the sole will wear too fast.

Fit is actually true to size, if you know how a "race" last or have any experience with correctly fit shoes, buy your running shoe size (I wear an 11 in running shoes).  I run these larger than my alpine and nordic ski boots which I wear 28.5 and 45 respectively. But going to a 46 was too much.
review.name: Missing full range of sizes

review.reviewBody: Great fit, extremely comfortable, durable, and a great value for any cyclist that puts in a lot of miles. Highly recommend.
review.name: Excellent shoe

review.reviewBody: Wore these straight out of the box for this year’s Unbound 200.  While I encountered many challenges during the race, none were shoe related, despite gobs of sticky mud and nearly five miles of hike-a-bike.  They remained comfortable and stiff throughout over 15 hours of continuous use.  Great shoes!  (Runs a half size small)
review.name: Unbound Tested

review.reviewBody: You generally get what you pay for with anything in the bike industry, these shoes are no exception. However, it's always important to consider the purpose and use for a product. In the case of the XC902 S-Phyre they are 100%, without question a Bike Racers Shoe. They are super light, stiff, and feel great on my feet (I wear 8.5-9US and got the 42EU). They include a couple interchangeable arch supports to help dial in fit for a variety of feet. The heel cup is wonderfully designed, the silver material on the inside is hard to explain, but it's almost like a cat tongue, your heel slides into the shoe without issue but when pedaling the fabric grips your heel reducing foot movement in the shoe. Concerning drawbacks, I would refer back to my statement about purpose and use for bike products. I wouldn't say this is a shoe that is going to last a serious XC rider more than a year or two. Since they're purpose built for high performance you lose some durability in the sole and lugs. But if you're looking for no compromise performance, these are the shoes for you.
review.name: Raceday Ready!

review.reviewBody:
The previous generation of these shoes was perfect for my narrow, flat feet. So comfortable that I put SPD's on my road and just used these shoes. Also, if I am going to pay $400, I am going to get my money's worth. The one Achilles' heel? The sole wasn't thick enough and wore quickly. 

When I saw the redesigned/beefier sole of this new shoe, I was very excited to try them out...thinking that Shimano may have crafted the perfect shoe (for me). Alas, they changed the internal footbed. The previous had a relatively flat/gentle curve in the arch that sat flush with the sidewall of the shoe. The arch in the new model is more pronounced and doesn't sit flush. This causes the edge of the footbed to dig into the arch of my foot...causing discomfort with every pedal stroke. If not for this dealbreaker, the shoes are tremendous.
review.name: A perfect shoe scuttled by the foot bed

name: XC902 S-PHYRE Cycling Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.name: Polar II Glove - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gordini Polar II Glove - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought these for skiing out West.  The gloves felt great when I first tried them on - soft, comfortable, seemingly good quality.  So I cut the tags off and gave them a trial run on a walk in the mountains.  Walk wasn't long - maybe 45 minutes - in cold temperatures (probably 20 degrees Fahrenheit or so).  My hands were ice blocks even before the end of the walk.  I'm surprised and disappointed because for the cost and the apparent quality, I really thought these gloves would have kept my hands much warmer.  Backcountry won't accept the return now because I cut the tags off (my fault, although there's really not a good way to try them out without doing so).  Unfortunately, these just turned out to be an expensive mistake.  Would not recommend.
review.name: Not warm

name: Polar II Glove - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Distance Headlamp Battery online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The battery that came with the lamp is still going strong and lasts forever 

But I’m the kinda dude who likes a back up on hand just incase.
review.name: Redundancy

review.reviewBody: recomended if your using the distance headlamp very easy to switch out and lasts while.
review.name: Good battery

review.reviewBody: I have several BD headlamps: Storm 450 and 500 series. I really am glad I stepped up to the Distance. The amount of light and beam focus is outstanding. Feels very comfortable wearing as a headband or using the full top strap for a more secure fit. The Distance works with my BD Vapor helmet without any issues. It’s built well and I like having a back up battery for the long overnight adventures. The RBG options are great too for night vision - same easy to use BD controls. I use the light as my go to for hiking and climbing.
review.name: Exceptional Head Lamp

review.reviewBody: Easiest battery pack to change on a BD headlamp i’ve owned to date. LED indicators make checking the charge simple as well.
review.name: Easy to change

review.reviewBody: I am hoping this headlamp will last me for life, it is top notch! Very bright, and reliable.
review.name: Best headlamp ever

review.reviewBody: Not much to say here: redundancy of critical systems in the wilderness can be a life saver. Pricey, but cheaper than stumbling in the dark and twisting your ankle and getting evac'd by helicopter.
review.name: Nice backup for the Distance 1500 Headlamp

review.reviewBody:
Going on a long hike and need to ensure I have light the entire time.
Great peace of mind
review.name: Battery

review.reviewBody: I bought an extra battery but honestly they hold a charge so well you'll get many hours before you need to swap. It's a great purchase.
review.name: Awesome Battery

review.reviewBody: This Teva's are super cute and most importantly comfortable. This style in particular looks really nice and pretty because of the braid on the top side. The color is perfect, very neutral.
review.name: I recomend it 100%

review.reviewBody: Wear these as often as I can. So comfortable and the flat form ads just a little more style . Cannot say enough .
review.name: I would buy this shoe again and again !

review.reviewBody: Love these-versatile brown, awesome cushion yet sleek.
review.name: Fashion/function meet

review.reviewBody: I love Teva. It is the best ever and I wear them daily.
review.name: Super cute

review.reviewBody: The platform doesn't offer enough support for my knees. I love the look but they hurt my knees. I wish I could return them but I wore them a couple of times as I wanted to keep them.
review.name: I need more support

review.reviewBody: These are the best. Great transition footwear from late summer to fall Looks great with jeans, capris or dress them up to work casual. this is my 2nd pair and I will purchase more.
review.name: Most Comfortable shoes

review.reviewBody: I wear a 91/2...the 9 fits great! I get lots of compliments and they are super comfortable!
review.name: Very cute and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Super comfy, only thing that's a little weird (but it's totally a me thing as all Tevas are similar) is the toe strap not being over where toes meet the foot
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: I was so excited to buy these shoes to wear on a trip. They broke within my first day wearing them - I walked 1.5 miles on a flat surface and the strap on the left shoe connecting to the platform came out. I called customer service to get a new pair and it's going to take another two weeks after the return pair, which is after my trip. Disappointed because they were really great for the two hours I wore them before they broke!
review.name: Do not buy these shoes- they broke on my first wear

review.reviewBody: Cute shoes. Felt great on but I was looking to replace an older pair of wedge Tevas that looked a little dressier. These shoes seemed more casual especially with the location of the front strap showing the entire toe.
review.name: Great shoe but a little more casual than I was looking for

hasVariant.description: Buy the Big Agnes Rapide SL Insulated Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used on my backpack elk hunt in colorado. Could not have been more comfortable . Don't hesitate to buy
review.name: Rapid sl pad

review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable
Pleasantly firm when fully inflated
A little noisy, but not bad
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody:
We got Double Wide sleeping pad to match our King Solomon Double Sleeping Bag. It can be a bit narrow if you prefer to have space between you and your partner but is perfect if you like to cuddle. Don't get it if you plan to use with your friends. It's definitely not wide enough for two adults in separate sleeping bags. 

The included pump sack is huge and can fully inflate the pad in a matter of minutes. This pad is really thick! At the same time, even the Double Wide packs incredibly small and takes no space in your bag. I would recommend using a thin closed cell foam pad under it, if you want to increase the R value on really cold nights.
review.name: Warm and comfy

review.reviewBody: This pad is awesome. I upgraded from a Klymit that ive had for years and patched a few times. I wanted something with a little more cush. This is it. Only feels a bit heavier than the klymit. just a tad bigger when its packed. I tried the big agnes DIVIDE and the design isnt as comfy. I also got the Rapide wide version. The extra few incheds makes a big diference.
review.name: more comfy than i thought it would be.

review.reviewBody: I bought this pad for a big camping trip and after using it for one night, it stopped holding air. I happened to be in Steamboat where Big Agnes is based. I stopped in their store and they looked at the pad and told me that Backcountry sold me a sales sample, which is not the final product and is more likely to be defective. Backcountry’s return policy says they only accept undamaged, unused gear. My pad was used for one night and clearly damaged/defective so I didn’t bother trying to return it. I guess this is why it’s best to purchase  directly from the manufacturer and not from a retailer selling samples at discounted prices - Big Agnes gave me store credit but couldn’t refund me since I didn’t purchase from them.
review.name: Started leaking after one night

review.reviewBody: I used this Big Agnes pad for 4 nights. It gets 3 stars for comfort and 1 star for noise. If you shift positions at night - from back to your side or vice versa, this pad makes a lot of noise. It squeaks and makes a plastic rustling sound. Loud enough to wake up anyone else in the tent. Two of us had Big Agnes pads and you could hear the squeaking all through the night. It needs some kind of lightweight fabric liner. Or can’t they invent non- squeak plastic?
review.name: Not for people who move when sleeping

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and does not sound like a potato chip bag when you roll around.
review.name: Comfort plus

review.reviewBody: A slept on it the other weekend. With a Zen bivy bed. It was a amazing system. Comfortable with the big Agnes repide. I'm gonna buy it again for my girlfriend when she starts.
review.name: Sleep

name: Rapide SL Insulated Sleeping Pad
Rapide SL Insulated Sleeping Pad

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve tried to get used to these bibs for over a month and I hate them. I never want to wear them again. They designed the shorts to be extra tight at the bottoms to avoid silicone grip, but it just mean the shorts are always uncomfortable and your legs always look like sausages. Also, they are low-rise at the waist, so they are not any more comfortable than shorts without bibs. Avoid if you can.
review.name: Worst bibs ever

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the padding- Progetto x2 is my favorite for comfort. I got burgundy color which is beautiful. I like how minimalistic it is with stitching which I'm not a big fan of. But the straps are too short. Also I wish the front strap attachment would be stitched more to the sides for the straps don't run straight on my breast. Bibs definitely run small but Castelli is know for it.
review.name: Room for improvement

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Castelli's Free Aero have been my long-time favorite until this new version came on the market. The legs are longer than before, which I don't like. The straps fit very funny over the breast, unless, I suppose, you have fairly small breasts which I do not. They hit right in the center of the breast and cannot, unlike on the previous models, the strap cannot be moved to the side.
I really liked the gray color and was sorry to have to return them. 
If you have very long legs and smaller type of breasts they are probably perfect.
For reference, I am 5.1, 103 lb, xs fits fine except for the above issues.
review.name: Legs too long, straps poor fit

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: Normally wear a small/med. bought a Med. Couldn't get it over my hips
review.name: Runs smal!

name: Free Aero RC Bib Short - Women's

hasVariant.name: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfy bag. Shape helps with sleeping on side. Love the gills to be able to vent. fantastic sleeping bag
review.name: Comfort

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been in the market for a new sleeping bag for a while. I dislike traditional mummy bags, but several friends recommended the Disco. I finally got one for myself. After one night of sleep, I'm glad I did! Looking forward to many more nights in this amazing sleeping bag.
review.name: Lives up to the hype!

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: I own several Nemo products, one tent going on 20 years. Nemo is always my first go to for camping products. The Disco bag is another example of a great product, that will get a lot of use in the coming years. It’s as advertised, comfy, warm, and well-made.
review.name: Nemo Disco Sleeping Bag

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've used this bag for a while now and it's nothing short of the best I've ever owned. I've used in backpacking in Wyoming's Wind River Range, on riverbanks in New Hampshire, and car camping, too. It has delivered—no, excelled—in each of these places and met the demands with ease. As someone who's tall with broad shoulders the long version fits me perfectly. Plus, I get warm easily so having the vent option is a game changer. Add in the fact that this bag is made from recycled materials and easily reparable and this bag is simply untouchable. It's my favorite, hands down!
review.name: Simply the best

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've loved this Disco spoon bag since it first came out. And now it's even better, 100% recycled and recyclable. The perfect van camping bag for inside or on the roof.  The shape and weight of this 30º bag are perfectly suited for New England weather adventures. Curl up on your side when you need to for more warmth, or open the gills and lighten it up a bit. The new material is soft and much quieter. 100% recommend this new Disco
review.name: BEST overall bag

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: As a side sleeper with broad shoulders, most mummy bags have been a nightmare. The spoon shape of the Disco is incredibly roomy!
review.name: Great for broad shoulders

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this bag after using an older riff 30 degree for a few years. This newer version of the disco extremely comfortable with the updated "blanket fold" as it gets rid of the cold spot that I have experianced on my older riff. I have also noticed that the the thermo gills are more effective on the newer badg as well! For reference I am 6' 5'' 200lbs and the long leaves me with plenty of room and isn't tight at all.
review.name: Love the updated features (disco 15 long)

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: This bag is super comfy had has some great features. I cannot give a long term review at this time as I just recently upgraded my sleep system with this bag but I love the spoon shape as I am a side sleeper. The gills make a huge difference. I normally get hot when sleeping so having the gill feature is really nice. While not a performance feature I also love the Chai color. The long term storage bag is also well made and handy. Nemo has become one of my go to brands and anytime I need new gear Nemo is the first place I check.
review.name: Great Bag!

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: This bag is the perfect combination of comfort and packability. It’s nice to be able to spread out after a long day of hiking in the mountains while also staying warm. Can’t wait to use this on an upcoming backcountry hunt!
review.name: Perfect backcountry bag

review.itemreviewed: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's
review.reviewBody: Cannot say enough positive things about this bag! Temperature rating is spot on and how spacious it is is amazing for side sleepers. I used the Nemo Riff for many years and this is my new favorite.
review.name: Best sleeping bag I've ever owned!

name: Disco Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 30F Down - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Ultra 50 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Like other reviewers, I found the sizing on these to be way off. I am reliably a 10.5 and rarely have a problem ordering shoes online. Based on the other reviews, I ordered an 11.5. It fits snugly enough that I then ordered a 12 just to be sure. That pair was barely longer, but felt overly roomy in the toe box. I am keeping the first pair as they do feel comfortable, appear to be good quality, and are well priced for GTX shoes, but at this point I can't comment on durability. I'd recommend sizing up a full size, and if you have a narrow foot, these might not be for you.
review.name: Believe the reviews re: sizing!

review.itemreviewed: Ultra 50 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Positives: roomy toe box for wider foot; grippy sole; seemingly no break in needed; Goretex essential in wet conditions 
Negatives: flimsy insole (zero arch support; plan on replacing unless you have dead flat feet); restrictive tongue that may not accommodate an exceptionally high instep
review.name: Comfortable from the get go

review.itemreviewed: Ultra 50 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these shoes for running when it rains or when the ground is wet (trail or dirt roads) and they are great.  They are a bit tight on the fit to the extent that I assumed they would be uncomfortable on longer runs (for me 3-5 miles) but there is no discomfort during or after.  That being said, I like to wear them when I am attempting to beat my best times on my regular loops as they are light compared to my Hokas.  I also find myself wearing these sneakers as casual wear, given the bright colors.  There is some threading on the tongue that is coming out so build quality may not be the best.
review.name: Love these tight fit running shoes

review.itemreviewed: Ultra 50 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like the shoes, but it took me two exchanges and then finally a trip into the Salt Lake store to get the right fit. I typically wear 10.5 I ended up with a 11.5. A bit crazy if you ask me.
review.name: Sizes are wack

review.itemreviewed: Ultra 50 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ordered a pair. Quality seems nice. Look cool. I usually wear a 9. these felt like a 7. Returning.
review.name: Too Small

name: Ultra 50 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Good for these late fall days  love the thicker sole I do change the insole to a more cushioned insole, and space to add a foot warming pad without discomfort. And they do look good !  Fits to size , and I always order them in line
review.name: Comfort

review.reviewBody: Very nice shoe.  Not sure about the review about Merrill’s fitting, “old, wide hobbit feet.”  Pretty rude, especially when most shoes are made for people who don’t have wide feet.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a trip to the redwoods national forest. These were super comfortable and really didn’t need breaking in as I was only able to wear them once for a 2 mile walk prior to our trip and never had any problems! Definitely size down a half size.
review.name: Great shoe for beginner hikers

review.reviewBody: These shoes are so comfortable!  Cushioning without being sloppy, at least for me.  As I don't hike much these days, these are great for easy walks. I got a 10.5 which fits me well, although I  sometimes need an 11 in Merrell walking shoes. It doesn't feel too big for me.  It's my go anywhere shoe these days.
review.name: Comfortable, breathable shoes

review.reviewBody: great shoe, very comfortable, walked 14km on first day and no blisters or sore spots, good arch support and wide in the toe
review.name: Very happy with shoes

review.reviewBody:
favorite new hikers used all around CO to hike trails, waterfalls, over boulders and slippery ,rooted narrow terrains
.
review.name: new favs

review.reviewBody: Good shoe, light but not super light. I wore it around the house first to make sure I liked it. My foot is hard to fit.
review.name: Worth buying!

review.reviewBody: I am a power walker.   I broke my foot a few months ago and my foot specialist suggested I get a shoe that would not let my foot bend near the break if I wanted to continue walking.  I tried on many, many shoes and your Merrill’s did the trick.   I’m thrilled and walking again.  Thank you
review.name: Thrilled with Merrills

review.reviewBody: I am happy with this shoe, used them for hiking, good grip, sturdy
review.name: Out in the woods

review.reviewBody: Loved these!  They were perfect for hiking through streams and light climbing.  I think a half size larger would’ve been a slightly better fit, but I’m still very happy with these.
review.name: Good shoes!

name: Speed Eco Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Don't buy these. The are not waterproof - the moisture soaked thru on a 30' walk in mildly wet conditions. Also, the fit is terrible. They should be made to fit over clothing but the waist is too tight even though the rest of the pants fit OK. Very disappointed and should have read the reviews that said, ominously, NOT WATERPROOF...LEAKED IMMEDIATELY...nice color, though. I got them b/c I wanted rainpants that weren't black.
review.name: Soaked thru in misty/drizzly weather

review.reviewBody: Soaked through. Hard to get dry for the next day's hike
review.name: Not waterproof

review.reviewBody: From the first wear, these pants were leaking through the membrane. After one quick walk (less than 30 minutes) in moderate rain, the water had seeped through the membrane at the front of both thighs, leaving my pants underneath soaked. This worsened in the second and third wear. I'm hoping this can be resolved through warranty as it's clearly a defect, but I won't be repurchasing.
review.name: Leaked immediately

review.reviewBody: After many years with my Marmot rain pants and one very fun butt slide down snow, it was time for me to invest in new rain pants. I could not have been much more disappointed by these :( I wore these 4-5 times on a single backpacking trip, with no extreme or unusual use (no butt sliding this time!). The entire seat is now fraying and torn open in 2 places. I sat still on flat slabs of rock a couple times while cooking, but otherwise only wore these while lounging in camp or hiking. NOT DURABLE AT ALL :( I'd recommend Marmot instead.
review.name: Least durable rain pant I've ever owned

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'7" but these rain pants seemed designed for someone about 6'! You can't hem these with the zipper so I had to put a tuck right below the knee. I should have returned for a smaller size but did not have time. Just be aware that these may run long for you.
review.name: Too long

review.reviewBody: Comfy and light, shaving ounces off my pack, and still makes a comfy pillow when its dry.
review.name: Awesome lightweight rain pants

review.reviewBody: They are perfect for what I want them for: skiing and walking the beach in the rain
review.name: Prefect for snow or rain! I would definitely buy again.

review.reviewBody: Wore these foraging for mushrooms in Oregon's coastal range. These kept me dry and cozy as I walked through rain and wet brush for hours
review.name: Lightweight and kept me dry!

review.reviewBody: Great pants that don't take up much room in your bag. Waterproof and durable.
review.name: Lightweight and waterproof

review.reviewBody: Took these rain pants on a ~550km 22-day thru-hike in the Canadian Rockies. My boyfriend and I both had a pair and ours both wore out at the seam on the inside leg above both ankles within a day or two of hiking with them. OR needs to add a more robust seam at this place so it doesn't tear. Due to dirt build-up, gear tape just fell off when we tried to repair on-trail. The rain pants were necessary on our trip for bush-whacking and protection from rain and snow, and did provide us with protection, but would definitely not buy again for this price due to durability issues - next time it's frog toggs for $30 for sure.
review.name: Not durable

name: Helium Rain Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Beal Joker Unicore Golden Dry Climbing Rope - 9.1mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Joker Unicore Golden Dry Climbing Rope - 9.1mm
hasVariant.description: Buy the Beal Joker Unicore Golden Dry Climbing Rope - 9.1mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Joker Unicore Golden Dry Climbing Rope - 9.1mm
review.reviewBody: I’ve used the joker for several months now between sport and alpine climbing. I think it’s one of the best skinny ropes for sport and still holds its own in the alpine. My experience with durability has been good so far, but my favorite thing about this rope is the perfect handling. Stiff enough to clip easily and soft enough to knot well and resist coiling.
review.name: One rope quiver

review.itemreviewed: Joker Unicore Golden Dry Climbing Rope - 9.1mm
review.reviewBody: I bought this rope 4 months ago and it has been a great change of pace Frome my previous ropes. It’s unicore construction means you won’t get any pig-tailing, or other random rope shenanigans. It’s light weight and handling have made it my favorite rope for alpine climbing and climbs with long approaches. 10/10 great product
review.name: Neal joker review, built for the Alpine

review.itemreviewed: Joker Unicore Golden Dry Climbing Rope - 9.1mm
review.reviewBody: After two routes, my brand new Joker is retired with multiple coreshots. The rope never saw rockfall, and never saw a fall on lead or top rope. There are lots of great ropes in this size range, pick any of those.
review.name: Multiple Coreshots
comment: You can damage a rope without falls or rock fall exposure. Your photo does not show a core shot. Looks to me like localized damage to the sheath from abrasion running over a sharp edge. This can happen to any rope. Likely operator error; not indicative of product failure.

review.itemreviewed: Joker Unicore Golden Dry Climbing Rope - 9.1mm
review.reviewBody:
The rope was light and soft ,feels great.
But?
Disappointingly, this rope was produced in 2015,I can only have a very short storage time.
review.name: Good rope and Bad date

name: Joker Unicore Golden Dry Climbing Rope - 9.1mm

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using the RockLock Screwgate Carabiner, Distance LT 1100 Headlamp, 18mm Nylon Runners, and Astro 300 Headlamp, and I must say, they are top-notch! The RockLock carabiner is secure and easy to handle, making it perfect for climbing. The Distance LT 1100 Headlamp is impressively bright, ideal for night hikes, and has a great battery life. The 18mm Nylon Runners are durable and versatile, holding up well under various conditions. The Astro 300 Headlamp is compact yet powerful, providing just the right amount of light for camping trips. Highly recommend all these products for any outdoor enthusiast!
review.name: Reliable Gear for Every Adventure

review.reviewBody: Ideal headlamp with good light spread. Light weight and with adjustable brightness makes it great for early hikes.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Worked great, looked nice, overall a great product!
review.name: Astro 300 headlamp

review.reviewBody: Perfect for night time hiking on the trails. Nice, even, widespread light.
review.name: Great headlamp

review.reviewBody: Our light go out often and looking for a handheld flashlight interferes with using both hands. This was a good buy,
review.name: Lights Out-Head lamp on

review.reviewBody: Great adaptation to a classic. Bringing in new battery tech is working great!
review.name: Strong headlanp

review.reviewBody: Sweet little headlamp. Not the brightest but certainly good enough for my 12 year old. Price was great too as my kiddo is prone to losing things.
review.name: Sweet little headlamp. Not the

review.reviewBody: Bought three for the grandkids. They just used them daily at summer camp. Easy to use for kids age 6 and up, simple controls. Very bright but easy to dim for use in the tent or to save the battery. As inexpensive as these are they are so much better than the best headlamps available a generation ago.
review.name: Great little headlamps

review.reviewBody: Really nice little headlamp. Simple, one button, no fuss functionality!
review.name: Bright!

review.reviewBody: Love this headlamp, exactly as I expected. Not too heavy. Would recommend!
review.name: Very satisfied!

name: Astro 300 Headlamp

hasVariant.description: Buy the Arbor Carbon Coda Snowboard - 2025 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The Coda has long been a high-level, cross-terrain performer. But the all-new Coda – designed with Pat Moore – breaks the evolutionary sound barrier with its forward-facing approach to all-mountain expectations. Its camber profile is supported by Grip Tech contact points to offer a unique combination of power and control. Its wider-platform tip and tail are designed to drive clean turns at high speeds through mixed conditions. Its Mountain Twin design provides riders with the toolkit needed to get into and out of dicey spots. This upgraded Carbon version incorporates the added response and snap that only carbon inlays vector netting can. This is the next-gen Coda – and Pat Moore is putting his name and stamp of approval on it.
review.name: Arbor Carbon Coda

name: Carbon Coda Snowboard - 2025

review.reviewBody: I LIKED A LOT OF THEM, VERY COMFORTABLES, AN VERY GOOD IN TRAINING
review.name: EXCELLENT TENNIS

review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing Salomons for over a decade but these pair are one of the best. They look good, they feel good, the size is exact, and they are very light
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: I really like these shoes but I refuse to spend the $ on the high priced shoes. Only purchased when there was a descent sale. Ever so slight a snug fit at first but was alright.  Have not truly tested these shoes yet but I will. Comfy fit and looks good. I'd definitely buy more if pricing was a bit more friendly.
review.name: So far so good.

review.reviewBody: Over the last five years  I have bought 12 pair of Salomon shoes and boots.   I love the fit materials and durability. There’s plenty of toe room shoes are excellent on my arch. I spent most of my days on my feet and outdoors.  All But one pair of these shoes are still in service -
review.name: Pair number 11

review.reviewBody: These are the only shoes I can walk in for miles 6 to 10 miles a day
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: Best speed cross variant I’ve owned. Super grippy.
review.name: Best

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned several variations of the Speedcross, but I have to say the offroad variant is the best. Bravo 👏🏼
review.name: Best Speedcross

review.reviewBody: This is indeed the best shoes I got: it suits any environment from indoor working, city walking to trail and hiking; it is super stylish (I got so many complements from friends); and sturdy and reliable (I've been wearing a pair for 3 years and it is still functioning very well!!!)
review.name: Best trail shoes ever

review.reviewBody: I got them a month and half ago to ware them at work ONLY because they look so cool. I work at my family’s wine store and my work mostly consists of being behind a desk on a computer. As you can see from the photos the outside spikes on the sole wore off in a month which is very disappointing considering the quality and the price I paid to ware the Salomon brand. Not cool at all.
review.name: Cool looking
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Beauty right out of the box and instant comfort. All a person needs.
review.name: Always a gorgeous shoe

name: Speedcross Offroad Shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Does not fit her bottle. I believe it would fit the specific bottle size she has, but does not. Can I exchange?
review.name: Does not fit bottle.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's okay because it does the job. What I don't like: I use a boot on my flask, so it's a bit more difficult to insert the flask in the sling. The sling material and strap feel flimsy. I would have preferred a different material but didn't want the molle option. No other options available. Oh, well.
review.name: small packable bottle sling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Handy to keep my water bottle hands free while walking. The wide strap is comfortable, but attaches to the sling through a flat plastic “loop". The strap tends to twist/bunch up in the very narrow loop and becomes jammed in there. A better design would be attaching the strap with a swivel clip.
review.name: Could use some re-engineering

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very convenient to carry water bottle while visiting Brookgreen Gardens.
review.name: Convenient

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This are nice to have so my grandkids have free hands, but I'm not happy because of the trouble I had with the water bottles color. The slings are on the expensive side for what they are.
review.name: This are nice to have

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I drink iced coffee year round and i absolutely love this tumbler for my daily java fix. It keeps my coffee nice and cold and also works great for hot beverages. It is the perfect size for smaller hands and is lightweight as well.
review.name: My favorite coffee tumbler

review.reviewBody: Perfect for times you need your water on you but do not have a large bag to carry your bottle all day. Comfortable and allows you to not need to carry the bottle.
review.name: Small Packable Bottle Sling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Hydroflask sling bag is a convenient and practical accessory for anyone who loves to carry their Hydroflask with them on the go. Its design allows for easy and secure transport of your Hydroflask, ensuring that you have hydration readily available wherever you are. The sling bag is lightweight and comfortable to wear, with an adjustable strap that can be customized to fit your preferences.
review.name: MUST HAVE

review.reviewBody: Love it! Using on longer walks as the weather warms up and am hands free when walking the dog.
review.name: Great Hands Feee Carrying

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the bottle sling. Will work out great at Disney to stay hydrated in june
review.name: Bottle Sling

name: Small Packable Bottle Sling

description: Buy the MSR Alpine Tool Fork online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpine Tool Fork
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Alpine Tool Fork online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Excellent piece of old school steel; modernized. Brilliant, nicely weighted; +++the tool capacity (both in fit; and in being tough enough to actually be used to tighten loose nuts/bolts) is admirable.
The tines do well to stick and stab foods; and also to release items when put on a dish, plate; or in mouth. Yum; love hot meals on the trail! Or in the camper as it is. :)
Got at least four in the kitchen, three in the Westy. It is my kids go to fork. Loves the tool aspect fwiw.
Prob but another couple or so soon. Not compensated for any of these fine words; but this is a fork for the decades. +++
review.name: Camp fork; modernized and proper.

review.reviewBody: Really good ,, and useful item ,, love the design ,, and materials high quality of stainless, recomended this item to my fellow mountainners
review.name: Great items

review.reviewBody: I have added some more of the Titan Tool Forks to my Emergency Bag- but not my first of these ""Tool Spoons or Forks""!
review.name: Strong Stainless Steel fork / tool combination

review.reviewBody: Great product, only thing I'd change is offering a long version too. After using the long spoon from MSR I've gotten a little spoiled.
review.name: Great, would love to see a long version

review.reviewBody: Lightweight. Stabs things. Perfect for eating with.
review.name: This thing is forking awesome.

review.reviewBody: The pinks and purples in the “multicolored purple” gloves are much more muted/greyish in person compared to the product photos. And also the left glove has a lot of blue on it? See photo comparing the product pic on the left and the in person pic on the right. Will be returning. Otherwise the gloves fit and felt good.
review.name: Color not as expected

review.reviewBody: I've had these for about a month, really have enjoyed them in all the rides I've used then. Gel pads are the right size in the right places. Snug fit going over the hand but comfy once they are on. Haven't used them an a hotter day, but great at middle too cooler temps
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: I adore these Castelli gloves.  There's no fussy velcro closure, they just slip on.  The padding is plentiful and helps long rides feel comfy.  On top of all that, they're cute!  Come in lots of colors and patterns.
review.name: Best bike gloves ever!

review.reviewBody: They fit nice and look great with the vivid colors. I like the pressure point pads and their placements. I find they might be a little bit warm for warmer weather, at least in my case. My hands tend to sweat a lot though. They're not as easy to get off as other velcro type closure gloves, but thet slip on very easily.
review.name: Nice look and no velcro

name: Competizione 2 Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband and he loves them. They run true to size and they wash well. He wears them for hiking and for casual dining. Columbia is pretty much the only brand he’s interested in when it comes to pants.
review.name: Great Pants!

review.reviewBody:
When they arrived, I checked to see if they fitted. They did. This was good. The beige pair of trousers was excellent. The black pair has no pockets making them useless for me.
I will have to throw them out.
I will never order from this company again..
review.name: Two pairs

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit and excellent material. Doesn’t stick to your skin.
review.name: Great material and great fit. Good for everything.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really great material, nice to wear in the humidity.
review.name: Really good fit, I like the built in belt. Good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very confort. Beautifull and soft.  I love it a lot.
review.name: Excelent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants are just what I wanted for my travel overseas. They are lightweight, comfortable and easy to pack. They are well made and the price was right on my budget. They fit perfectly!
review.name: Perfect for traveling

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My 17 year old bass fisherman wears these daily.  He’s tall and lean making it hard to find a perfect fit.  The 30x34 size fit perfect.  They wash easy (no shrinkage or wrinkles).  Everyday wear.  It’s the third time I’ve purchased.   Tusk is his favorite color.
review.name: Lucky Fishing Pants

review.reviewBody: There charge $6.99 for any type of return. It's so deep hidden in their policy. They are very much misleading people when they say 100% guaranteed returns.
review.name: Bad return policy
comment: We understand your frustration with the return shipping fee. We are committed to clear communication and are reviewing our return policy information to ensure it is easily accessible to our customers.  We have sent you an email with further details.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Net pockets had a hole and I lost my pocket knife the first time I wore them.  Not good if you like your pocket knife.
review.name: Hole in the pocket
comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We are so sorry that this was your experience with this product. If you would like, please check out our warranty information by scrolling to the bottom of the page and clicking warranty.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these pants - have 2 pair of them now. Planning to wear them while traveling. Like the secure zip pocket.
review.name: Good travel pants

name: Silver Ridge Cargo Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Hello , My son wore these for the first time at Nature Camp. The Nature Camp involved much river play and the Velcro already failed.
review.name: Velcro failed

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of Keen's. A friend recommended them to me for a good travel sandal. I've taken them for two pre-trip walks. They are comfortable and seem to provide good ankle support. zthey look pretty spiffy, too. My only disappointment is I had hoped to wear my orthotics with them and the fit is too tight for that.
review.name: Lightweight, comfortable sandal

review.reviewBody: The shoes I purchased are Christmas gifts for my grandchildren, so have not been worn yet. But they look great!
review.name: Have Not Worn Shoes - but Keen Service is AWESOME!

review.reviewBody: I got the shoes out of the box & wore them. No pain, no blisters, no breaking in. Amazing & so worth buying again. I'm an adult with teeny, tiny feet & buy children's shoes quite often. It is rare when kids' shoes are this well made!
review.name: First Time Fantastic

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for a pair of sandals that could be used for water play but still worked for other activities my kids were into like soccer and running. These were perfect, and now they won't take them off!
review.name: Awesome! All-activity sandals

review.reviewBody: It's my second pair. I love them. The first one lasted 8 years and is still ok, just dirty. Hope this new one will be just as good.
review.name: Super comfortable and lasting forever

review.reviewBody: My son has been wearing Keen sandals all summer, every summer since he could walk. They fit great, dry quickly, and are great quality (last long enough to be passed down).
review.name: Great, as always

review.reviewBody: Great comfortable cute shoe variety of nice colors and prints.This is my 5th pair.
review.name: Seacamp CNX

review.reviewBody: The sandal is comfortable. The strap is weird. You can’t really tighten it past it’s normal setting without it shifting off the shoe. My biggest complaint is that it’s claim to be waterproof. The fabric isn’t very hydrophobic. My son got his wet yesterday and this morning it’s still a little damp. I’m not a fan of having their little feet staying wet in their shoe. We live in the pnw
review.name: Not waterproof at all

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my 7yo who has wide feet. These were too narrow, so had to return. Overall the shoe was difficult for my kid to get on and off independently. The latching portion is just too tight and not flexible enough and didn't have a wide enough opening for her to slip the foot in easily. Love the concept of these shoes, but for a hookandloop/velcro shoe, I want my kid to be able to get on and off without help.
review.name: Narrow, Difficult to get on/off

name: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Boys'

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Stretch Regular Trousers - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Came on here to see what other colours there is as I’m wanting another pair of these Abisko Trail Stretch Trousers…….and ended up writing this review..!!  
I do already have some other items of Fjallraven gear. 
These are now my ‘go to trousers’ when the weather is warmer here in England. 
I have had these about 6 week and initially they felt too hard wearing to be cool in warm weather, in a sense that they could be too warm…….they ARE hard wearing, but great in warmer weather and so I needn’t have worried(they were ideal in the warmer weather of Madeira)..!! 
The stretch in them is brilliant, either when hiking or for general use. 
I am a men’s UK size 30” - 32” and went for the 30”. A touch ‘snug’ but how I’d personally prefer them.
Right, best go back to shopping….!!!
review.name: Fantastic Abisko Trail Stretch Trousers

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Stretch Regular Trousers - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The craftsmanship and quality materials are exactly what you expect from Fjall. I sent these back for three reasons. 
1) The taper below the knee wasn't strong enough. Not a fan of excess material in that area of a pant.
2) The stretch was nice & very comfortable, but the durability for anything other than high alpine(no bushwacking) or post hike pub probably fails.
3) When considering the materials used, many other manufactuers sell a similar pant for 50% less the cost.
review.name: More Business Casual Than Business Backcountry

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Stretch Regular Trousers - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for a light weight snug trouser with deep pockets but not too deep. These fit the bill perfectly. I’m well pleased. 10%.
review.name: Super light for hot climes

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Stretch Regular Trousers - Men's
review.reviewBody: I found these to fit too snug and the material too thin. I returned them and replaced them with the Abisko Hike.
review.name: Not for me

name: Abisko Trail Stretch Regular Trousers - Men's

description: Buy the Dynafit Tour Vario 2.0 Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tour Vario 2.0 Ski Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Dynafit Tour Vario 2.0 Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The telescoping feature allows you to be flexible depending on the angle of the terrain, and it is easy to use even with gloves on. They’re remarkably light so they’re easy to carry on a back or in hand, but also durable enough for the skin up.
review.name: Light, Durable, Reliable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just returned from a two week ski touring trip, and these poles worked great. Nice and lightweight, but also durable. Adjustment is easy, and the powder baskets are a good size. the wrist straps seem to stay put after you adjust them, and they're comfortable during ascents.
review.name: Perfect touring pole

review.reviewBody: I have used this pole for one season already both at the resort and in the backcountry. Adjustability is solid (I'm 5'10") in the size range. They are light weight enough for a day climbing over 10,000' of vert so your arms aren't tired from lifting the poles. They have a quality vibration dampening feel when at the resort or going across chunder in the backcountry. One aspect I really like about this pole and others from Dynafit is the very top of the pole. I like to rest my hands on the very top of the pole when I'm standing. The larger surface area and rounded edges make for a comfortable hand rest.
review.name: Quality Adjustable Pole

name: Tour Vario 2.0 Ski Poles

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and fit great pockets are a little shallow though.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair- have the same in navy. Very comfortable regardless of the heat.  My only complaint is only one back pocket and it’s on the right!   For decades I have put my wallet in my left pocket.  Must be an industry thing as other companies are doing the same.   Who decided the right side is the “right” side!!  Majority of people are right-handed so you take your wallet out with your left, freeing your dominant hand with better dexterity to pick out the right credit card or bills.
review.name: Really nice but….

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Hight quality stretch fabric...wonderful quality!!
review.name: Short that you need!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the cut and fit of these shorts. I wish I had bought a few more pairs.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shorts for every day, hiking or any activity.  Great quality and seem durable to hold up to any task.
review.name: Great shorts!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My new favorite shorts. Great for gym or just wearing around.
review.name: Shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice stretchy comfortable short. Better than patagonia running short.
review.name: Nice shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I picked the wrong size, but since it is final sell, it cannot be returned
review.name: I picked the wrong size
comment:
Hello,

 Thank you for posting your review. We are sorry to hear that our product is not as you expected. We're committed to making sure to turn your experience around to a rather delightful one. If you require our assistance, please contact us using our Contact Us form on the following website: https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat so we can help you further. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9AM - 5PM EST. 

Thank you!

review.name: Good buy

review.reviewBody: Not only are the poles quality, they are very light.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Between my wife and me, this is our third set of these poles. They’re light, strong, and super easy to unfold/fold while running.
review.name: The best trail running poles out there

review.reviewBody: I used these poles for two multi day hikes in Scotland and Iceland and they were fantastic. They fold down to perfectly to fit in carry on luggage and are extremely light weight on the trail. They also have a nice extension feature to use when going downhill.
review.name: Great poles for any hiking adventure!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for an ultra race and absolutely love them so far. They unfold and snap in place very fast, are so light I don't even feel them on my back, and feel sturdy on tough uphills. So happy with this purchase!
review.name: Awesome running poles

review.reviewBody: I originally bought these for walking steep uphill segments, but lately I have been rehabbing a rolled ankle and using them for running as well. These poles are awesome, they weigh nothing and feel sturdy. Folding and unfolding them is easy, I appreciate the larger release button compared to the previous version. I have two minor suggestions: 1) the straps are excellent, but every now and then I use them without the straps. In this situation, I wish the little shelf where your pinky rests were bigger. With sweaty hands it is hard to stay on the grip. 2) i appreciate the option of the rubber tips, i prefer these in most situations except ice. but I can't seem to unscrew the metal tips.
review.name: Great poles

review.reviewBody: Poles are great for long trail hike and solid snow and dirt off trail. Do not use in deep snow. I broke my last pair in that way. Not for skiings or snowshoeing.
review.name: Light trekking poles. Excellent

review.reviewBody: I successfully used the Carbon Z poles to set many personal records within my last year of ultra marathon racing. The materials and durability is unmatched. Such a great team behind the design as well.
review.name: Greatest Trekking Poles for Ultra Marathons!

review.reviewBody: Great poles. They are very well designed, yet simple and straightforward making them easy to use. Very efficient breakdown and setup, easy to stow on my vest. Super light, strong. Makes a huge difference for the long trail runs I've used them on - mainly ascending. Would highly recommend.
review.name: Love 'em

review.reviewBody: This poles are awesome, they are so light you can forget you even have them with you. Easy to deploy and secure in place. The tip is very functional for trail running and grips feel good so far.
review.name: Light as feathers but mighty strong

review.reviewBody:
i love them but not super tough.
i’ve broken two so far.
review.name: light and great but have broken two during races now

name: Distance Carbon Z Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: I have used Shimano MTB shoes exclusively for decades because they have always fit my wide American feet perfectly and last a long time. When my most recent pair wore out, I ordered these with confidence thinking they would fit just as all the previous pairs had. Unfortunately, I was wrong. Shimano must have changed to European fit somewhere along the way. I ordered the same size I have used for years (43), but these shoes were too narrow and shallow. The velcro barely connected over my arch (less than 1/2"). It's a shame, too, because I really like these shoes. I do recommend them if you have narrow feet. They seem light for an MTB shoe, and well-built.
review.name: Too small for my wide feet

name: XC1 Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: My middle schooler bikes to school everyday for 15 minutes. The temperature goes down to lower 30s in the morning in winter. I was looking for a warm but light jacket that also blocks wind. This jacket meets all requirements. It also works as middle layer for skiing. He is pretty happy with the jacket.

review.reviewBody: I bought this coat for my son. It is very warm and cozy. The shell of this coat is made of a very durable material. My son wears it every day to school. I will buy another one soon.

I used it as a layer on a weekend backpacking trip and it was a great piece. Easy to stow when I got too warm and then quickly throw back on when we stopped for a break and to the summit.

review.reviewBody: I’ve tried so many cycling shoes, looking for something that was comfortable with no socks. These are amazing! Wide toe box, ultra-breathable, and well placed BOA. I went a half size down based on other reviews, and the fit is perfect. I can’t stress enough how comfortable these are with no socks.
review.name: Perfect for barefoot riding!

review.reviewBody:
These road shoes are unique, they have a much wider and more rounded toe box, the upper from the bottom of the instep forward is a soft, breathable mesh, and there's no closure of any type across the forefoot.

These road shoes are designed for a foot that's both wider and high volume, right through to the heel, which is also wider than in any other road shoe I've tried.

I wanted to love these shoes, but although I have a wider forefoot, I don't have a high volume foot, and the heel cup was way too wide, I could easily insert a fingertip on either side of my heel, and heel slip was pronounced.

So, didn't work out for me, but Lake should be applauded for making a shoe for those who simply can't fit into the typical narrow euro style shoes, with pointed toes, a narrow toe box, and a super snug heel cup. 

Anyone who's tired of squeezing their feet into too tight bike shoes should give these a try.

Also, Lake has, by far, the most comprehensive sizing guide, and on their website they provide the length and width specs for every one of their shoes, in every size and width. I used their sizing guide, and found their recommendation to be spot-on for sizing.

I gave these shoes four stars, I think the heel cup should have been a bit narrower, but if the shoe fits&
review.name: Perfect For Wide, High Volume Feet
comment: Thank you for the detailed review.  I also have feet that are wide across the toes but not at the heal.  I was so excited about these shoes when I saw them, but my foot shape must be some kind of freak-of-nature and so the wait continues for a wide toe, narrow heal cycling shoe.

review.reviewBody:
For reference Me: 5'7", 146, 68yr old male. Purely recreational, mostly solo rider for 16 years. Instead of chasing PR's, now focused on stability, comfort, and safety first equipment. Starting with my new 2020 Diverge with 38c tires and future shock.
Experiencing increasing foot numbness for a while, probably from age induced flattening and spreading of my metatarsals and flat arches that are now allowing the ankle to roll increasingly inward. 
Feeling the compression from my previous Italian designed shoes, I started my search for a wider fitting shoe. 
Tried the Sidi Genius Mega, nope, still too much metatarsal compression. 
Tried the Lake CX238 as it was described as wide fitting, nope, felt just as tight as the Sidi Mega I did a side by side comparison with.
Instead of ordering more shoes based on advertising descriptions and review opinions 
I decided to get serious about the math involved in a correct fit. 
Sidi, Giro, Specialized, Bontrager, etc, shame on you! 
None publish the width specs for their shoes. Even called the Gearheads here and other sites hoping they had a secret file of specs proved fruitless.
Amazingly, the Lake cycling site is a model for the shoe fitting process. 
I followed the instructions to trace an outline of my foot with a cycling sock on, measured the length plus 5mm, measured the width, and referred to the sizing chart to see which models would fit. 
I measured 106mm in width. From the chart there were several models that would fit. Note, the CX238's I returned were 101 in width. 
There is a fit matrix chart which matches different foot shapes with models accommodating to that shape. This is where I decided the CX201 was the one to try. 
Width in my 43.5 size is 107mm and the shape is high volume according to the fit matrix chart. 
There are some really great reviews of the CX201 on Youtube so I won't rehash but will add my observations, relative to my profile, that I did not think they emphasized quite enough.
As the reviews show this shoe last is built like a hull for your foot. Your foot fits inside the foot bed instead of hanging over the edges of the foot bed like most conventional designs.  
After a number of 40 mile rides I am struck most by the stability the full foot bed produces. 
This "hull" spreads the pedaling force over the entire foot bed. No more sore "spots". My inward ankle roll is corrected and voila I have no knee irritation now with the extra support keeping my foot and knee aligned. The encompassing foot bed makes this shoe unbelievably stable when walking too. The rubber heel and toe protector give some grip. 
No more skating on vinyl flooring at the convenience store getting my Gatorade refill.
The forefoot mesh was very noticeably cooler, I live in FL. 
The single BOA draws the mid shoe and heel areas tighter without compressing the fore foot at all. You can actually wiggle your toes anytime.  I don't  feel a pressure point under the Boa either.
My right foot is slightly larger than my left, not by a lot but I always size any footwear to my slightly larger right foot. My right foot also suffers from a lingering high ankle sprain, so it likes even less compression. The CX201 really shines in this respect as there is a massive amount of adjustment available in the upper that easily compensates for my slight asymmetry. 
I was very concerned about heel lift as that aggravates my plantar fasciitis. 
The feeling at the heel is not as locked in as the Italian shoes but after adjusting the BOA to a comfortable level I got no heel lift and I don't sprint like Peter Sagan so it's no issue.
Their sizing (length) was spot on too.   
If your profile resembles mine, the CX201 offers some solutions to some common cycling footwear problems. 
More colors choices would be nice.
review.name: Comfort Plus Cycling Shoes
comment:
I agree that this new shoe design is a potential game changer for many who have trouble finding a wider, comfortable cycling shoe. The shoe's last more closely follows the natural shape of the foot across the top of the toe box, there's certainly more room than in almost any other "wide" cycling shoe.

The issue for me was the heel cup, it's also very wide, and I don't have a high-volume foot or a wider heel.

Heel fit and slip were issues, and there were noticeable gaps on either side of the heel, even though the shoe was the correct size. Tightening a Boa doesn't do anything to close-in a too-wide heel cup.

I'm going to try the CX238 in wide, that may be a better fit for me.

As for sizing, the Lake sizing guidelines were excellent, and spot-on for this shoe. I recommend taking the time to accurately measure the length and width of your feet using these guidelines. The guidelines on the Lake website are more extensive than what's shown here on CC.

Lake provides the exact length and width fit specs for every one of their shoes, something  every manufacturer should do.

name: CX201 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Scooped this up as the 3mm hex I've been using for several years doesn't seat well and tends to cam out, especially when employing the ball end.

As one would expect, this offering from Park Tool is superior. Only nitpick would be the handle could be of better, grippier material.
review.name: Your Basic P-handled Hex Wrench

review.reviewBody: I needed something to adjust the brakepads on my gravel bike. This works perfectly.
review.name: Perfect

name: P-Handled Hex Wrench

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a light weight MTB short with a stretch fabric and found the Zoic Ether shorts. Perfect short for hot weather but also works well with colder temperatures. 

Fits just above the knee so they don’t interfere with pedaling in the saddle. 

Even though I have a 35” waist I opted for an XL to accommodate a road bike padded compression short. Works great.
review.name: Excellent MTB shorts !

name: Ether Camo Short - Men's

description: Buy the Dometic CFX3 45 Powered Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: CFX3 45 Powered Cooler
hasVariant.description: Buy the Dometic CFX3 45 Powered Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great product. Fits more than I thought and is the perfect size
review.name: Perfect size.

review.reviewBody: The best value and excellent quality don’t leave home without it 😁
review.name: CFX3 45

review.reviewBody: Great to keep meat frozen when traveling across the country.
review.name: Perfect Sized Freezer

review.reviewBody: Great cooler.  Easy on the power consumption.  Love being able to remove lid easily for cleaning.  Needs work on the lid.  You have to push on it to ensure it locks close.  Once you have that habit formed it not a huge deal.  But at this price point I don't expect to have to do it.
review.name: One of the best.

review.reviewBody: I've had this cooler for a month and so far, so good.  I've not taken it camping yet, but I will in the near future. For road trips and shopping around town, it seems to work very well, even inside a blazing hot vehicle. The CFX3 45 is a little heavy.  Maybe next year if they go back on sale again during Labor Day, I'll purchase the 35.
review.name: Excellent cooler

review.reviewBody: I had to return the first one I purchased, but now that I have a good functioning cooler, I almost feel like I should have gotten one bigger... haha.  It's great.
review.name: Would Recommend to Friends

review.reviewBody: I bought this cfx3 45 a couple years ago from a 4x company. This unit is quiet, when its in your vehicle you'll never hear it running. It cools down pretty quick. I also bought the cover for it. If the weight of a fridge is an issue.. You might choose a smaller model. This comes in at around 41lbs empty. Kind of pricey  but I do believe you get what you pay for. I've owned some of the cheaper brands and they feel and look cheap. I highly recommend this unit.
review.name: A Beast of a machine

review.reviewBody: Physically a little heavy but hopefully that is a sign of its durability. Extremely quite operation. The unit is electrically efficient as well. I hope it remains reliable over time.
review.name: Happy

review.reviewBody: The Dometic CFX3 45 makes travel much easier and less messy. You don't have to worry about keeping the cooler full of ice, draining it, wet food, etc, plug it in and forget it, COLD food and beverages
review.name: MUCH EASIER

review.reviewBody: The day the cooler was delivered from Dometic, I plugged it into two different 110 outlets and a 12v outlet and cooler’s compressor would not start and I would receive an error 33 on the display. I’m waiting to hear back from Customer Service. I had high hopes for this product and hopefully the issue will be resolved quickly.
review.name: Compressor would not start upon initial start up
comment:
Hi, 

We are very sorry for your experience. Have you opened a ticket with us yet? 
https://www.dometic.com/en-us/support/product-support-form#contact-us

If so, our colleagues will soon get in contact with you. 

Kind regards, 
Dometic

name: CFX3 45 Powered Cooler

description: Buy the BlackStrap Team Hood Balaclava Print online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Team Hood Balaclava Print
hasVariant.description: Buy the BlackStrap Team Hood Balaclava Print online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The mask part stays up really well and keeps you warm.
review.name: Back on my BS

review.reviewBody:
Easy to wear over or under a helmet or another hood...The double layer design of this hood makes it easy to be compliant for “masking up”.
The prints are super fun. LOVE the versatility of these hoods.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: I love my expedition balaclavas and decided to give this model a try. As soon as I got it, I thought that the attachment behind the head (where the straps tighten) looked flimsy. One gentle wash later the attachment has almost shredded. Super disappointed. Stick with the expedition!
review.name: Attachment deteriorated after one wash
comment: Thank you for letting us know about your experience with your new Team Hood, we stand behind our gear and will replace any item with a manufacturing defect within one year of your purchase! You can reach out to us at support@blackstrap.com to start the warranty process.

review.reviewBody: Keeps me warm when ripping the pow curves!!! Plus utnlook cool
review.name: Amazing Hood

review.reviewBody: certainly not as bulky as some of the other over the helmet options out there which is appreciated when wearing it for a few hours straight. I find myself using this more an more when doing everyday things when I grab a jacket that doesn't have a built in hood. The adjustable straps are key and just be sure to not tighten these down too much with each use as I can see them losing their tension over time.
review.name: Team Hood - Digital Camo

review.reviewBody:
So awesome!
It took me this long to realize it goes best over my helmet rather than under it 😂 
I love it and do recommend it to friends on the 
Mountain.
Although it wasn’t the one I had picked out in my order I am still enjoying it.
Idk what happened to the cursive “Blackstrap” logo on the hood I ordered but this one will do :)
review.name: Team Hood Balaclava with cursive logo??

review.reviewBody: I have been looking for a face covering that wouldn’t get wet and freeze to my face with the cold wind and this hood was perfect. The ability to quickly and easily transition the face shield part from fully up and covering to tucked under your chin is game changing. It fit over my helmet very easily and I was able to tighten/loosen the drawstring for the perfect fit. Worked great for a week in Montana with temps between the high teens and twenties. The only downside I could find for me was that it felt a bit tight under my chin if I kept it there for too long, but that wasn’t that much of a problem.
review.name: Awesome solution

review.reviewBody: Love love love the team hood! Big enough to go over my helmet, keeps my face warm, and the neck is long enough that it doesn't come out of my jacket! Super awesome product and super soft and comfy!
review.name: SUCH A RAD HOOD!

review.reviewBody: I received this item on Tuesday and on Wednesday I was out on the hill in very cold Midwest temps, wind and snow. Absolutely worth every penny! Warm, comfortable and function as advertised. I wore mine over my Smith helmet and it was great fit. Highly recommended.
Stops wind completely and is 10x more comfortable wearing my helmet either the Balaclava over it instead of directly on my head. Don't sweat nearly as much this way. Absolutely love it.
review.name: Love my over the helmet Balaclava

name: Team Hood Balaclava Print

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love this, but I just couldn’t. I think it runs a little big and didn’t fit the way I wanted to. Maybe I should have gotten a size down :/
review.name: Wish it was better

review.reviewBody: Since this dress is one piece the only way to get it on is to contort to get into the hole at the back. While it’s stretchy I still felt like the seams would rip if I stretched it far enough to climb into. I regularly practice yoga so am pretty flexible but still couldn’t make it work. I decided to return. Backcountry customer service helping with that return was great!
review.name: Cute but impossible to put on

review.reviewBody: The dress is cute, but it's incredibly difficult to get on and off. I felt like I was going to dislocate my should (only slight exaggeration) trying to get the dress off. I returned it right away.
review.name: Poorly designed

review.reviewBody: I am 40f, 34DDD, 5ft tall, and 155lbs and the xl is a little big on me. The inseam and idea is fantastic. The grip on the thighs was a really great choice and was more significant than the v2 outdoor voices dress. The neck to armpit seam gaped once I tightened it, and everywhere is a little loose.  I'm going to need to tape my breasts or wear a sports bra, and like the ov dress I think the align bra will line up with the silhouette perfect. I am a lover of dresses with shorts (xl in halara and large in ov) and this is my 12th one. This dress is a really nice scuba/pointe knit, study fabric and is nicely holding is shape but also stretchy.  It is thicker than the halara dresses, and nothing like the ov material. I think this will look nice enough to wear golfing or on a date and the material is thick enough to really give a smooth look. I'm super excited to exchange for the size down.
review.name: Freaking adorable!

review.reviewBody: I am 5'8 145lbs. I usually wear a small top and am between a medium and large for bottoms. I have trouble with onesies because of my longer torso and wide hips, but this material is forgiving for a range of body types. I purchased a medium and it fits well, the only negative is there is a little loose fabric on the low back at the bottom of the keyhole. I plan to wear it anyway, as it is not that noticeable.
review.name: Sporty and fun

review.reviewBody: This dress looks so cute on the model, but it's just not as flattering in real life. It's hard to get on, the shorts are not very comfortable underneath, and runs a little large.
review.name: Not as cute as I hoped

review.reviewBody: Oh my goodness, I was so stressed when first tried to put this dang dress on. I finally checked the reviews, and saw that people stepped through the neck hole to put it on! And that worked once I loosened the straps a bit. Does need a bra under, which is my only downside really. Yes, it’s still a bit tricky to go to the bathroom, but not too bad. This dress is so flattering and comfortable though! Worth it!
review.name: Through the neck hole!

review.reviewBody:
Super cute but pilled after first use. This is a little surprising considering the price point.  Looks super cute - wished it had a better bra and was easier to get off. 
I have purchased one very similar from HALARA and it’s held up better and was cheaper
review.name: Super cute but pilled after first wear

review.reviewBody: Once you get the dress on, super cute, really love the style and fit. Wish it had more bra support would be my only criticism. However, getting into and out of the dress is an absolute nightmare because of the built in shorts. Easiest way was to put the bottoms on first then carefully bend yourself into a pretzel to get in the top without ripping it. Ultimately I wouldn’t be able to deal with that every time I wanted to wear so I returned after just trying on. Doesn’t matter how cute it is on, if you can’t actually get it onto your body.
review.name: Cute but good luck getting in&out of it

review.reviewBody: Very cute style, but had to return due lack of bra cups and no support for chest. I would recommend Backcountry revise this style to include more support.
review.name: Cute Style but no bra cups built in

name: Destination Dress - Women's
