hasVariant.description: Buy the S.O.L Survive Outdoors Longer Flat Pack Sink online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My family spends a significant amount of time camping. One of my issues for years was having a sink that was big and bulky for washing dishes. This sink was seriously a wonderful addition to our camping gear. This sink dries quickly after use, is easy to clean and collapses to flat. The ability to flatten it is great for storage while camping and transport. This sink does not collapse during use and it is very sturdy.
review.name: Packs flat for easy transport.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The flat pack collapsible sink has been a life savor this summer while camping and made cleaning up a breeze.  It holds 8 liters of water for washing dishes or washing up while camping, and it has a tight closed drain at the bottom for easy draining.  It has also come in handy as a bucket or to carry supplies in, the carry handles are very sturdy.  Great for any outdoor use like hiking, camping, very versatile and compact for transporting.  The SOL flat pack sink is a definite must have and has been a great addition to our camping gear.  Highly recommended.
review.name: A Camping Must Have

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sink is perfect! When camping I usually use a plastic tote but this sink is a game changer. It’s not too big or too small so it doesn’t take up much space with my camping things. I like that it drains and holds water like a regular sink. It’s easy to clean too! It’s awesome.
review.name: Awesome idea

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This beats any bin or tub you could pack for camping. Even if it wasn't flat pack having the drain at the bottom is really convenient. The flat pack works really well, it's pretty sturdy so you really have to push it down. It feels solid, the sink has no problem holding a full tub of water and dishes. I like the drain, it seals well and also feels sturdy, just don't lose it! I Wish it was attached somehow.
review.name: Perfect little sink for camping!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great sink for the outdoors. The easy to pack and use is a great feature for us. Doesn’t take up a lot of space and light enough to carry. The sink is well constructed and no leaks. Perfect for camping or just using outside.
review.name: Durable and compact

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this camping sink to be able to do dishes while tent camping and it definitely fits the bill. It's very easy to use, and folds pretty flat, which is perfect. Space is at a premium in our car, so I needed something that wouldn't take up a lot of space. We haven't used it camping yet, but my 2.5 year old has put it through the wringer and it's holding up great. She's been playing in and one it and it still looks brand new. Hoping that means it'll be durable when we use it for it's actual intended use.
review.name: Great Camping Sink

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We LOVE our SOL Flat Pack 8 Liter Sink for camping! The drain has a removable strainer/stopper. Very handy! The only down side (hence 4 out of 5 stars) at this point, is the collapsible walls are a bit stiff and therefore one has to really play with it to get it to collapse. Otherwise, its a great addition to my car camping kitchen!
review.name: Would highly recommend!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was the first time I've ever seen a collapsible sink like this.  It is perfect for camping and keeping in your emergency storage supplies.  It's amazing how much space is saved when folded up.  I believe this is a must have!
review.name: The coolest must have!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this sink.  It is so nice to be able to wash my dishes while I am camping, so I don't have to worry about the bugs flying around the dirty dishes. I love how it folds down, so it doesn't take up much space.  It is very easy to fold and pop up.  I also like the side handles it has.  This makes it very easy to carry.  The drain works really well, and when you put in the stop, it seems to hold a tight fit, and doesn't let water through.  The only thing I did not like about this sink is it doesn't have anywhere to hold the water, so you must bring your own and pour it in.  Overall this sink works well and I would highly recommend it.
review.name: Great For Camping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The SOL ( Survive Outdoors Longer) Flat Pack Sink 8L is a good product. It held water just fine, no leaking. It is a very convenient product!
review.name: Good product

name: Flat Pack Sink

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The boots are warm and waterproof. I get compliments when I wear them. They've done beautifully so far. Already making memories with them as they've helped me trudge through 2-3 feet of snow to cut down our Christmas tree. My feet stayed warm and dry. So far they've outperformed other very popular big brand boots I've owned. Also, I really appreciate the very roomy toe box. BOGS hit me up about doing an honest review product swap. I'm in the PNW and would love to put your boots to the test!
review.name: My favorite boots

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Took these boots on a trip to the Finnish Lapland's. They are so comfortable and warm! This was my first bogs purchase and won't be my last. Shoes fit true to size. Customer service was excellent in helping me make an initial shoe selection. And shipping was fast
review.name: Comfortable and warm!

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was initially drawn to Bogs' commitment to sustainability and that they are a local company. Love their styles, too! Ordered these boots for the kiddo. They were a half-size smaller than their sizing chart suggested, but their returns and exchange program was incredibly easy to navigate. We have the correct fit now, & the boots are amazing! I'm hoping he grows out of them before he wears 'em out, so I can inherit them!
review.name: Runs small, but great boot and excellent customer service

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, warm boots for walking to work in New England, especially after the leather upper has broken in. Roomy toebox which is nice for someone like me with a wide forefoot. The sole is very comfortable and grippy, my only small issue is that the grooves in the boot that make it so grippy on snow also happen to be very good at trapping snow and ice when you bring them inside, much more so than other winter boots. Even after a few hard stomps and taps I still get a hefty puddle around the shoes once I come inside.
review.name: Comfy winter boots

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Couldn't get my foot in with out stretching out tongue on boot.
review.name: Warm boots & keeps my feet dry.

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Your Bogs only come in medium width. Some adults need wide. I emailed you and was told that the men's would be wider. So I ordered a mens size and it was not wider. So, all said... I will not order from you.
review.name: Not WIDE enough

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I need a WIDE... I was told the men's were wider than the women's but that still did not work. Thus I returned it.
review.name: Not WIDE enough

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased 3 styles of Bogs sub zero temperature waterproof boots (including this one, for a trip inside the Arctic Circle to see the Northern lights. With proper layers of warm woolen and thermal socks, these Bogs boots kept our feet warm and dry for many hours each night. We were complimented several times by different guides for our choice in footwear.
review.name: Worked great inside the Arctic Circle even in the dead of wi

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love my new Bogs and haven't even put them to work yet. But trust the many positive reviews I've seen online.
review.name: Bogs, My new favorite brand!

review.itemreviewed: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for my son on Black Friday. Great quality for the price. I'm thinking I need a pair.
review.name: Beautiful Bogs Boots

name: Arcata Urban Leather Mid Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Altra Escalante 2.5 Running Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Escalante 2.5 Running Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Escalante 2.5 Running Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is the most recognizable shoe that I ever wore. It truly delivers a differentiated running experience in terms of lightness, comfort, flexibility. A very narrow excellence that was definitely achieved with the 2.5 and miserably lost with the 3. We need to go back. Please don't make us buy used shoes!!!
review.name: Please don't lose the opportunity

review.reviewBody: The .5 editions of the Escalante's are always the best. This is the best shoes I've had in a while. I wish the 3's were more like this. The sole lasts longer, the tongue is more comfortable and cooler, and is an overall better shoe. I don't like that they change so much from the 2.5 to the 3's. I wish they would release this shoe again, I'd buy 3 pairs.
review.name: I wish the 3's were more like this

review.reviewBody: Why'd they have to change this shoe? I've logged over a 1,000 miles on multiple pairs of escalante 2's and 2.5's, but won't spring for any of the new road shoes when I try them on. I wish Altra had never sold out. VF Corp seems to be more about cheap production and breaking into non-runner markets, while the milk the origin story of the brand for as long as they can.
review.name: Durable, Comfortable, and a Tragic Loss

review.reviewBody: This (the 2.5) is hands down the most comfortable shoe I've ever run in. The upper is minimal, breathable and sock-like. The toe box fits my wide, hard to please feet. The newer Esc. 3 feels no way near as good on my feet with its more conventional thick tongue and padding. Since buying the 3 I've bought three additional pairs of the 2.5 which are now waiting patiently in their boxes. Long live the 2.5.
review.name: Favourite ever road shoe

review.reviewBody: I started wearing Altra shoes when I developed achilles and knee problems. My 1st few pairs were the Solstice. When they were discontinued I switched to the Escalante.Tongue like solstice would make it better
review.name: I will buy again

review.reviewBody: This is easily the best overall Altra I've owned. Fitnent, color, durability. Then the new version went narrower and now this isnt available. What's the replacement? Ugh. . . So sad.
review.name: This is easily the best everyday Altra SADLY!

review.reviewBody: This shoe is perfect. I have others that I am rotating through, but both of my other brands are too tight in the toe area. The Altra Escalante fits perfect in the back and has enough room from the ball of the foot forward that my foot isn't constricted. The shoe is built well enough to protect my feet, but is not overbuilt, so my foot can do what it naturally wants to do. I am adjusting to zero drop, so rotating through my shoes is okay, but I expect to be all Escalante in the next month or two.
review.name: This is my new shoe

review.reviewBody: I have a wide foot so I gave the Escalante 2.5 a try. Length is cut a bit short-toes rubbing. Instep/Midfoot not enough volume. Upper could use more air circulation. Color, feel, zero drop, lacing were all great. Altra really needs to make a road shoe in a wide width !!
review.name: Short Length, Narrow Midfoot

review.reviewBody: The best shoe on the market for general running and walking!The shoe allows the foot to strengthen and function as it was naturally intended.
review.name: I would buy this shoe again!

review.reviewBody: I've been running in brooks for years. I've been hiking in Altra lone peaks for several years and loved them. I thought I'd try out the running line. Brooks makes a good running shoe. I've logged many miles in them. I've take the escalantes out for probably 50 miles so far and absolutely love them. Will definitely buy again.
review.name: Transitioning from Brooks

name: Escalante 2.5 Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Absolutely awful — I did 3 laps and the front straps kept sliding off. Horrible fit. Would not recommend.
review.name: DO NOT GET THESE BINDINGS
comment:
Hi Sarah! 
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. 
We often make adjustments to our products based on direct customer feedback. We will be sure to pass on your feedback to the relevant department. 
We are sorry for any inconvenience caused.

review.reviewBody: Ordered my bindings online on the website. Went as smooth as possible.
review.name: Great website

review.reviewBody: my friends told me about this bindings, let's see what happens next week. :)
review.name: From Chile to California

review.reviewBody: Hello, I have damaged my Salomon bindings by using the wrong screwdriver. I would like to replace the screws, but I don't know the size of the binding screws. Could you tell me the size of the binding screws or send me a picture of the size? This is really important to me, thank you.
review.name: Problems with the bindings

review.reviewBody: I initially thought these bindings were pretty solid my first season with them, but now after riding my second with them the screw came off the right ankle strap and I lost the screws , luckily the ankle strap was still attached to the binding. I had it fixed at a service shop with a bolt and nut to tighten it up, it was pretty tightly secured for the interim solution. But after two trips later same problem on the same binding , this time I noticed at the top of the hill that the ankle strap screws came off and luckily again the ankle strap was still attached but I lost the screws. I couldn't go down the hill with only one strap which was very inconvenient so had to have the medical team snowmobile me down the run. My run ended early and now I'm worried if I do fix it again that same problem will happen again and will be stuck on top of a hill with one binding that works. My warranty ran out last month, I wish they had given extra screws because can't find any for this model on the site. I am also looking and shopping for another binding in the mean time. Salomon team please look into this issue or reach out to me.
review.name: Ankle strap keeps coming off after one season
comment: Hi, thank you for leaving this comment. We’re happy to know that our team is handling your case right now, please check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: Overall pretty decent. They work as expected with nice feel. Only issue is the toe bindings won’t tighten as much as I’d like them to.
review.name: Pretty good

review.reviewBody:
Initial delivery was okay. But ankle strap snapped after the 1rst run ever using them. Very disappointed. Got a replacement with warranty but that took almost 2 weeks.
So far I’m medium happy with the whole experience
review.name: Ankle strap snapped after 1rst run ever
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Rode with these bindings 3 times and the screw tabs came off and the part is hard to find. Mind you the bindings are brand new
review.name: not durable
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Purchased this for my daughter and so far they have been wonderful with one exception. The little screw fasteners on the toe clip came off the first run down the mountain. Luckily we found the bracket but had to get the ski shop to find something that would hold for the rest of the trip. This happened after we took the deck and bindings to the pro shop and they tightened everything double checking everything. Would be nice if these came with extras or a better design
review.name: Great bindings, but questionable screw attachment

review.reviewBody: roomy toe box as promised, very comfortable and light weight
review.name: roomy toe box as promised,

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits well and looks nice. I appreciate the environmentally friendly materials.
review.name: Comfy

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They replace a similar pair that I have had for about 15 years.
review.name: Great boots

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve hiked 4 times in this boot. They are waterproof, light, and comfortable.
review.name: Unbeatable boot for the price

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: they are comfortable and supportive but your sizing needs to be more consistent - I have sandals and 3 other pair of boots and they are all 8. 5 - one pair of boots is a little too big, so I ordered size 8 and got lucky with these
review.name: they are comfortable and supportive

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Keens are the perfect shoes for my foot type. I wear a size 9, normal width. These are my 2nd or 3rd pair of Targhee III. I tried other boots prior to my first pair but none fit like these do, so I stick with what I know I like. This time I tried a different color and I love the look! Stylish and rugged; what more could I ask for? I’m very happy with all Keen footwear and I’m always excited when I get a new pair. My feet thank me.
review.name: The most comfortable boots!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m on my 9th pair of these boots. I usually get around 400-450 miles out of a pair before I need new ones. I like the wide toe box for my arthritis. The waterproofing has only failed on one of the pairs of boots & I think that was because that pair got too hot in the back of my truck. They are “out of the box” comfortable and never need to be broken in. I recommend them to all of my hiking friends.
review.name: I love these boots

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've been wearing these for work for a couple weeks in foul weather. So far they are waterproof. I wish they were a little more slip resistant on wet surfaces. Also wish they offered it in wide. The color looks brighter online but not bad in person.
review.name: Sturdy boot

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love Keen's footwear and these Targhee III's are no different. The very first time I put them on they felt comfortable enough to wear all day. My feet run a little wide and these are perfect without ordering a wide. Wonderful boots.
review.name: Keen has always been a winner for my feet.

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable. No break in period. True to size. I do outside work like landscaping, tree felling lawn care etc. Disappointed in the durability. Started coming apart @ the toes on the side after only a few months
review.name: Comfortable but didnt last 3 months before ripping

name: Targhee III Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I have the women's version of this jacket but it is no longer available so I am leaving my review here on the men's version.

This jacket is so nice and warm for really windy cold rides, and at least for me fits true to size. the insulation placement is perfect for carrying a bum bag, and you it regulates heat nicely once you get warmed up a little bit. This jacket is also very durable, I have taken a crash or two in this and you would never be able to tell.

 All in all a great piece, only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because it tends to build up a little bit of condensation when you are working up a sweat. It wicks the moisture away from your skin so it doesn't make it uncomfortable or anything but at the end of your ride, it will be noticeable. This jacket would be a great cross-over piece for hiking or ski touring, and I have worn it out on really cold road rides as well.
review.name: Absolutely love this jacket!

name: Ranger Windbloc Fire Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Long Cotton Gauze Long-Sleeve Button-Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: I like this shirt, bought the white or off-white and the black. I forever wish things had pockets. It would have got a 5 star if it had functional, hip pockets. It runs oversized, I bought a medium and I can button it over my 38DDD bosoms.

review.itemreviewed: Long Cotton Gauze Long-Sleeve Button-Down - Women's
review.reviewBody: This was the perfect material and cut. EXACTLY the gauze coverup shirt I’ve been looking for. However, I was sent the wrong size. I had ordered a large and was sent an XS. And they no longer had size large after I received it. BUMMER! Seems to run slightly large as an oversized shirt should. I hope they do a repeat of this top.
review.name: Exactly what I was looking for

description: Buy the La Sportiva Mantra Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mantra Climbing Shoe
hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva Mantra Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I liked the shoes design, but I am more used to a harder rubber like the solutions. These are great if you like soft soles with the convenience of slip on
review.name: Pretty good

review.reviewBody:
I really enjoyed using them at the gym, but after only 3 months they are do for resoling. La Sportiva said that this can be expected for the no edge technology so keep that in mind. I own two more pairs of la Sportiva and none of them have the amount wear and tear that these got in this short period of time.

Sizing was the same as other La Sportiva shoes for me, they do tend to stretch a bit more though.
review.name: Nice shoe but poor longevity

review.reviewBody:
These fit true to La Sportiva size, but Sportivas run very large compared to street shoe sizing, so if you're familiar with La Sportiva, get somewhere around your normal size, but if you're going by street shoe size, you need to downsize.

I have found these to stretch less than anticipated, especially in the toe box, almost not at all for me, and I've used them 20+ sessions.  They were relatively comfortable right out of the box, but quite tight at the same time, and if I get them again, I'm going a half size larger.  Although this is purely a matter of comfort, not performance, as they perform impeccably at the current size.  That said, someone else told me they wished they had gone a half size smaller.  So who knows.

These are surprisingly supportive for how minimal they are.  It's basically a sock, but it doesn't feel that way at all when you're wearing it.  The heel is phenomenal for a slipper, the best I've had on any shoe, including lace and velcro, which includes many La Sportiva in this same size where the heel was still very good.
review.name: great

review.reviewBody: This is the first real upgrade to the simple sensitive slipper concept since the Cobra, and it is a worthy step forward!  As a fan of sensitive shoes I have always wanted something one step more sensitive until now.  This is it!  The ultimate soft climbing shoe.  A Vibram Grip2 sock with no edge benefits.  Fantastic!  I am sold!
review.name: Sportiva nails the sensitive slipper!

review.reviewBody: This is my first slipper and my first No-Edge shoe.  I wear a 43 Miura (lace + VS).  The Mantra is made on the same last as the Miura (PD75), so I bought a 43 Mantra.  The fit is comparable, as expected.  Its a little more snug across the forefoot, but after one session in the gym I noticed some stretch.  The heel feels like a second layer of skin on my foot, and its surprisingly comfortable for a performance fit shoe (my Miura VS make a 'hotspot' across my toes and the Mantra does not). The Mantra is super light, VERY flexible, and the most sensitive shoe I've worn.  The XS Grip2 rubber makes it stick to everything.  I have a feeling this will be my go to shoe when precision is key.
review.name: Another winner from Sportiva

name: Mantra Climbing Shoe

description: Buy the Rhino-Rack 6 Skis/4 Snowboards Ski & Snowboard Carrier online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 6 Skis/4 Snowboards Ski & Snowboard Carrier
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rhino-Rack 6 Skis/4 Snowboards Ski & Snowboard Carrier online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: A bit of a design flaw IMO in that the skis need to be in the middle of the rack for the latch to hold.  If you have to press down hard to close it (we had nordic skis so thicker than downhill skis) it's a pain in the butt to close and get latched so it could be locked.  We had to keep  moving the skis around to to find the sweet spot to get it so it would latch.  A slightly different design would have made this not an issue.
review.name: Pretty much works...

review.reviewBody: Weird locking mechanism. Hard to close when you have 3 or more boards. Cannot fit 4 male boards. You need to buy risers.i would not recommend. I bought a Thule instead
review.name: Get a Thule

name: 6 Skis/4 Snowboards Ski & Snowboard Carrier

hasVariant.name: P-6 Logo Crew T-Shirt - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia P-6 Logo Crew T-Shirt - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I absolutely adore this tee. The fit is perfect, the length is great, and the quality is what you’d expect from Patagonia, excellent. 

Each year I seem to find one tee that I fall in love with and buy every color and this is that tee. I have no doubt it’ll hold up through many washes. If you’re between sizes, I’d recommend sizing up though. It’s a slimmer fit versus some of their other items imo.
review.name: My favorite tee ever!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this tee! It’s really soft & fits great! I have the size Medium in gray. I’m 5’3 & 120 lbs. Seems to be very well made. I’ve had mine for quite awhile & the graphics have faded some. But! They have faded evenly & smoothly. A lot of shirts, the graphic will crack & peel. This one hasn’t done that at all. It just has this nice, well loved look. I always wash on cold & dry on low. I will continue to love this tee until it is no longer wearable. And even then I’ll probably just move it to my stash of “muck clothes”. Highly recommend!
review.name: One of My Favorite Tees!

name: P-6 Logo Crew T-Shirt - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought this piece of beauty at 40% discount. Backcountry always offer amazing price. natural and black plaid is one of the best color way of mackinaw cruiser.
review.name: Perfect Price. Beautiful color.

review.reviewBody: I owned a jacket in brown from the early 2000s. I sold it because I lost weight and the wool was just too uncomfortable. I really liked the look of the white and black plaid and with the sale it was down to a reasonable price. The fit and finish of this jacket was as good as the older one but the wool was far better. Really glad I was able to get one. I had a size 44 and the new jacket in large seams smaller. Fits great with a mid layer.
review.name: Improved

review.reviewBody: Been waiting to get one of these for a long time and finally pulled the trigger. Did not disappoint! You can feel the quality. My wife loves it on me. These run big, I wear an XXL in everything (including Filson shirts) and the XL Mackinaw fits great! Now I'm just mad because I want one in every color. Thanks for nothing Filson!
review.name: Filson Mackinaw

review.reviewBody:
Fits large.  Had to sens back for a large. XL was like a double x.  
The material is the best.  Such a classic tough look.  Heavy wool that keeps you so warm and looking classy.  Its my favorite jacket.  Work, Constuction sites, dinner, church...It WORKS'
review.name: Absolutely incredible material. Fits Lar

name: Mackinaw Cruiser Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: XC3 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Demensano cycling shoes wide forties are what fit me perfectly as a woman with a white foot.
Thi Is the second pair I have purchased, the first pair are still being used for spin.  The first pair were used over 5 years and thousands of miles, not including spin.

Highly recommend
review.name: Shonano Wide cycling clip in

review.itemreviewed: XC3 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought the XC3 wide, used about three rides and fits well.  More room in the toe box. The single BOA is not a problem.   Yes, what others here have said might be true for them, but you have to try them on a ride.   These, for the price, fit and comfort are better then what I had and no more toe ace at rides end.
review.name: Fits well, happy biker.

review.itemreviewed: XC3 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Looks like a great show but toe box even narrower than my also size 46 Garneau's. Putting that 46 normal and Shimano's 46 "wide" it's not wider a mill! Shimanoales their shoes way too narrow and roebpxes way too small - got burned time and again.
review.name: Great shoes, too narrow despite "wide" d

review.itemreviewed: XC3 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The crocs of cycling shoes. I got these because my high end Bontrager shoes with full carbon soles were feeling too tight and causing my feet to fall asleep. To my surprise they were 100 grams lighter per pair than shoes that cost $100 more. I don?t understand that. Plus the bottom has way more rubber for grip. So far the only negative is the laces are run through cloth instead of a plastic guide which makes it a little harder to get them tight. And the boa can go tighter one click at a time but not looser one click at a time. But that?s just nitpicking. My size 43s were 300grams each.
Usually I ride a size 42.5 but in these I had to order a 43.
review.name: Unbelievably Light

review.itemreviewed: XC3 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: shoes not wide enough...also, shoe tighening mechanism could easily be caught on brush along a narrow trail
review.name: wide is not wide enough

review.itemreviewed: XC3 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The boa tensioning cable is routed through webbing instead of plastic routing guides (plastic guides have much less friction). This makes it VERY difficult to get the shoe tight enough. Wish I would of been aware of this before I purchased. Other than that, it seems to be a good shoe.
review.name: one big weakness

review.itemreviewed: XC3 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shoe! Extremely comfortable. When I ordered, I was hesitant due to size for wide foot however, it was a perfect fit.
review.name: Schmano XC3

name: XC3 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Sadly the shoes dont all run the same width and length. I really loved my white pair and would give it 10 out of 10 review! yet the green are more narrow and a little shorter. I tried to size up and they arent the same. I would highly suggest all shoes and colors being the same as the whites for a more barefoot/minimalist experience.
review.name: not the same as my first pair

review.reviewBody: Their potential to perform is high, and I really love how they look. However, the toe flex groove is too far down for my foot (& others who've have tried on my pair). It hits the ball of my foot instead of running under & between my toes. Unfortunately it not only feels strange, but it also causes pain with standard use. Wish things were different, as I really love the design.
review.name: Not Fitting for Me

review.reviewBody: I was disappointed because the strap in the back is too loose for my ankle. The strap can not be tightened. I have to return them, it’s too bad because the sandals feel great on my foot bed. If you have thin ankles these shoes will not fit. Wish they had a way to tighten the back strap!!
review.name: Back strap too loose

review.reviewBody: Have only had them for a month thus far. Loving the color and look. Sizing is great. A little stiff/hard under foot, although otherwise comfortable.
review.name: Great color. Good fit. A little hard under foot.

review.reviewBody: Took to Costa Rica and used for river rafting and strolling around town
review.name: Costa Rica approved

review.reviewBody:
Stylish. The shoes look great on. I was pleasantly surprised when I saw how great they look with a pair of ankle length jeans and plain t-shirt. The hardware and color was enough of an accent to elevate my look, clearly a statement piece. On two different occasions, acquaintances and friends complimented on how stylish my shoes were, enough to ask about the maker.  
Durability & Stability:  I've worn them on 3+ mile walks in SF, Oahu, all over Seattle, and even on oyster beds (not the smartest thing to do, esp while carrying a toddler), and the shoe held up. I've also tested them while boating and I was able to walk around without slipping or losing my balance.
review.name: Stylish & Durable

review.reviewBody: Great go-to sandals for walking dog in the rain, the beach, or just driving around doing errands. The back strap keeps them from falling off. The 2 top straps do become loose so I'm regularly having to tighten them, and the raised design on the foot bed takes time to get used to. Also, I like the material from which they're made.
review.name: Nice sandal with a couple small glitches

review.reviewBody:
I ordered these on a whim along with some close toe whitewater shoes.

They are fairly comfortable but a little loose and long, so I fear this wiggle room will negate some of the amazing grip of the soles when it matters most.

I will keep an eye on these in future years, hoping to see half sizes and/or an adjustable heel strap added.
review.name: Would prefer half sizes of back strap

review.reviewBody: I LOVE these sandals! I've worn them every day since I got them. They are incredibly comfortable and stylish enough to wear pretty much anywhere, and perform great on the water.
review.name: LOVE these river sandals!

review.reviewBody: The Astral Webber is a great Sandal. The neutral foot bed and grippy outsole make this great for daily wear or walking around the campsite. The straps provide a consistent hold to keep your foot in place while walking around on uneven terrain.
review.name: Neutral foot bed and grippy outsole

name: Webber Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: Purchased a size 4 and a size 6. The 4 fit much better in the waist, the 6 much better in the legs. Both were too short in the rise which started to bug me after a while. Neither fit perfectly so I returned.
review.name: Rise too short

review.reviewBody: Ferrosi pants are lightweight, dry quickly and are incredibly comfortable.  The waistband is soft and non-irritating.  A great pant for hiking or everyday activities.
review.name: great pants

review.reviewBody: Comfortable fabric with excellent stretch. Material is lightweight, but was easy to layer in colder temps.
review.name: Comfy, light weight hiking pants

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'9" which isn't terribly tall, but the pants were too short in the crotch, and the length. Seems like they would be really comfortable so it's a bummer they don't make in Tall.
review.name: too short

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit for me, better than regular length. Height 5 ft 4.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite hiking pants. They are stylish and the short length works great for me. I'm using these for field work now in chaparral and I've gotten a snag here and there, but no tears yet. Very comfortable for staying cool while scrambling and bushwacking.
review.name: Good for field work

review.reviewBody: Bought my first pair of OR pants about 15 years ago!  I still wear them so was comfortable to place an order on line for my current pair.  They are everything I was hoping for.  Same quality extremely comfortable and versatile.  Great for hikes and look good at the same time.  Shipping was free and delivery very quick.
review.name: Great versatile pants.  Comfortable, lightweight.

review.reviewBody:
These pants are so comfortable. There is a faint grid texture to them that’s great at wicking away moisture but they still feel and look so nice. They’re lightweight so I wouldn’t take them on a full blown bushwhack but on overgrown trails they feel like they’re going to hold up great.

I did notice that they run a hair big, I’m a 2 in most brands including Prana and found that these were a bit big in the waist. Not big enough to size down so the drawstring is much appreciated.

Will be buying a pair in every color.
review.name: Comfy, functional, sweat wicking!

review.reviewBody: Love these pants, they fit perfectly. I especially appreciate the deep pockets!
review.name: Deep pockets!

review.reviewBody: They may be the most comfortable pants I have ever trained in

name: Ferrosi Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Nite Ize Radiant 170 Rechargeable Task Light online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Radiant 170 Rechargeable Task Light
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nite Ize Radiant 170 Rechargeable Task Light online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought one and add it in my bike it looks modern and nice kool on my beach cruiser definitely add it in my e bike … red lights. Should be more brighter but I used the regular white
review.name: Great lights

review.reviewBody: This amazingly bright, adjustable device can be used for a variety of tasks. I currently use it to illuminate closets and cabinets. Love the attachment options.
review.name: Very bright, super useful

review.reviewBody: Bought this a month ago to attach to my wrist while walking the dogs at night.  The adjustable head allows it to lie flat on my forearm.  Perfect for visibility on those dark nights.  Recharges quickly and holds its charge.
review.name: Small, light and bright!

review.reviewBody: This nifty little light is so handy! It's incredibly bright for it's size, and I love the built in wire things I use to attach it to pretty much anything.
review.name: Extremely bright

review.reviewBody: Radiant 170
review.name: Light

review.reviewBody:
Here's my summary of the many features of this great little light: 1) Very bright white light modes 2) Good red-light & flashing red-light modes 3) Vertically adjustable light 4) Attach light using magnets, gear tie or put on the floor 5) Fast recharge time and long run times 6) Powered by on-board rechargeable battery or external sources 7) Can attach to a hat using the gear tie 8) Can use indoors and outdoors in many ways
I wish this light was available years ago. One of my best purchases
review.name: Excellent light

review.reviewBody: Very bright small light.. love that it recharges and has different settings.. On top of the magnetic option you can tie it on for extra hold with the built in cable ties.. My daughter wanted to ride her bike so why not let’s try it out.. That’s where the ties came in handy.. She thought that was really awesome.. I have a bugout bag and throw it in there for an extra light to have if we have a power outage at work or a easy go to light if I need to fix something that requires two hands
review.name: Very bright

name: Radiant 170 Rechargeable Task Light

hasVariant.description: Buy the Fox Racing Ranger Fire Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These must have been designed for a women's hands because you'll practically break your hand trying to pull these on over your knuckles (my hands literally ached after getting them on) and the fingers are too long. I typically wear Troy Lee gloves which fit perfect for reference. Lastly, they are bulky feeling and just don't give confidence when gripping the brake levers. AVOID!
review.name: Next to impossible to pull on; Bulky!

review.reviewBody: Runs very small, not warm at all, not touchscreen compatible (Fox won’t take them back).  Grip is good.
review.name: Not touchscreen compatible

review.reviewBody: The glove portion fits my hand as expected and is true to size.  The cuffs however require a bit of force to pull over the over the hand.  The cuff fits fine on the wrist once on but getting over the hand is an exercise.  I usually wear a large in Fox (and Giro and Assos) gloves and that's true here once on the hand.  The cuff seems like it's for a smaller glove and any tighter and this glove wouldn't fit.  I would consider sizing up if you have a larger hand or are on the larger end of a given size.  Gloves are nice and warm and holding up great.
review.name: Great gloves, tight wrists

review.reviewBody: As the title says, these are for mountain biking. I bought these gloves to extend my riding season.  They are very thin and have zero insulation on the palm and underside of the fingers. No big deal for the throttle hand, but it feels like grabbing the clutch lever with bare fingers. The grey silicone stripes do not grip the lever what-so-ever. My fingers were instantly cold as soon as I went over 10mph. It was in the mid 40s, so I expected my fingers to get cold, but not in the first 5 minutes of riding.  I noticed the seam was coming undone on the right thumb when I had to stop and warm up my fingers after the first 15 minutes of riding...
review.name: NOT DIRT BIKE GLOVES

name: Ranger Fire Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: purchased this a couple of months ago and finally used it today for a hike. I put them up when there was 6 inches on snow on the ground on top but when I took them off , one of them was torn and the other looks like it will in the next hike. I did not use them on rocks and some muddy sections and only one mile.
review.name: Lasted only 1 mile

review.reviewBody: I bought these for shoe cover for fat biking. My feet tend to run cold and I like running SPD. I have shimano "winter" boots which I find work to about -8 c before windchill. The average ride time being about an hour. I bought these and put them away and rhen El Nino came and I thought they may never be used. Then it got cold. Reall cold. -40c cold. Truly. And I deployed these. And my feet are toasty warm. No more frozen feet, not even cold feet. Warm. They are awkward for walking around on. They look kind of funny. But who cares. Survival isn't a fashion show. I don't know about water proofing - water doesn't exist in liquid form at -40 As a cover to supplement your boots they are excellent. These are likely overkill in many situations but if you are using in snow and cold I highly doubt you will find a better product. Thank you OR.
review.name: These are game changers

review.reviewBody: these are well designed and well made. The fact that the stood up to the yarding i had to do to get them on a pair of size 13 Danners is a testament to the ruggedness of the materials and stitching. I had originally hoped I could move them back and forth between boots for skiing, hiking, and  perhaps biking but after the struggle of getting them on my hiking boots, they are staying put for the winter. It may be that they will stretch over time to make this easier. we shall see
review.name: well designed, xl very tight on 13 boot

review.reviewBody: Last year out of the blue my feet started getting cold. I tried heated socks, but they're too finnicky. So I decided to give Outdoor Research X Gaiters a try. I've used them both ski touring and ice climbing and I am very happy. A few gripes. I got XL, which was hard to find, but the top closure isn't quite big enough for a muscly leg in ski boots, but it can be made to work. So far I have kept the bottom straps secure, but I'm not 100% happy with the toe bail of my crampons having a little slip of fabric between the crampon bail and the toe welt, so I might cut them where the diagram shows.
review.name: Toasty Feet!

review.reviewBody: I bought these to use on my winter hiking boots for hiking, snowshoeing, biking in temps well below freezing in the Winterpeg (Winnipeg) area. Temperatures go below -40 C/F but even at -20 C my feet get cold due to Raynauds. I have electric insoles that heat the toe area but managing the batteries/cables can be problematic. I am hoping the X-Gaiters are a simpler solution and keep my cold feet warm will repost about this. I ordered a size Large for my Solomon winter hiking boots (size 44 2/3 or US 10.5 with a 74 cm/23" rand circumference) or Scarpa Mistral GTX hiking boots (size 44 or US 10.5 with a 73 cm rand circ). The X-Gaiters fit these boots, with a struggle putting them on first time, but they should fit tight to trap the warmth. A hypalon strap on the bottom of the X-Gaiter it's toe down on the top of the boot's toe and there are lines for cutting the strap to customize the fit. I won't be cutting this strap as the X-Gatier fits the boot toe area okay and I think it is a good idea to leave it on so the toe area of the X-Gaiter does not ride up the boot. For boots with larger toes it may be suitable to cut this strap. The X-Gaiters are installed while the boot is off your foot. It would be difficult to put the X-Gaiters on to your boots while you have the boots on your feet. You open the X-Gaiter fasteners, put one down on your lap, insert the toe of the corresponding boot into the X-Gaiter toe area so the red silicone seal is on your boot rand, then place the X-Gaiter crossover bungee straps in the raised instep area of the boot sole, then pull the back of the X-Gaiter red silicone band up and over the back rand of the boot until it is at or above the top of the rand, forming a good seal. Then you cinch up the centre instep cord. Then put your boots on and close up the X-Gaiters. They could have: top velcro closure greater range for smaller calves; cordura exterior for crampon protection; a higher calf height/extendable sleeve for deep snow.
review.name: Looking forward to use in Winterpeg

review.reviewBody: Significantly increase the range of temperatures you can use your boots and shoes in! I use them ice climbing, skiing, and even mountain biking in the winter!
review.name: Worth the investment

review.reviewBody: Fits great over my AT ski boots for very cold days.
review.name: Really great on super cold days

review.reviewBody: This is really needed in a ski boot compatible version
review.name: This for ski boots!

review.reviewBody: I bought these to use with my La Sportiva Nepal Cubes mountaineering boots on my trip to Alaska. I spent 10 days total at Matanuska Glacier with high camp on the snow close at Scandinavian Peaks (alt ~ 6000-9000 ft). Temps were not low enough to test them for that, but I assure you that these kept my feet pretty dry all the time. Other expeditioners that were with me without them had serious issues due to wet boots (you are kicking snow 24/7). I?m happy. I wish the tips would not slide up an inch or so after 4 hrs of using them.
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody: If I could I'd give it 4.5 out of 5 stars, as these are *really* warm and just need a minor tweak or two. I've been using these "off label" with alpine touring boots for winter skiing, avalanche education, etc. Working as an instructor/guide I've put about 30 days on them so far. I need extra insulation as I have Raynaud's and these have kept my toes totally warm each day I've used them, down to single digits F. Very stoked. The little thumb loop to secure the side strap could be a bit bigger (to allow a gloved finger to fit) and a bit sturdier in the stitching (both of mine tore from the stitching, so I cut them off). The hook that secures the side strap is a bit too small. Consequently, any time I step into deep snow, the strap gets pulled off the hook when I pick my foot up out of the snow.
review.name: Warm as advertised; could use a couple tweaks

name: X-Gaiter

review.reviewBody: The best snowshoe for Denali and other alpine altitude mountains! Very lightweight and strong straps to hold your triple insulated boots in all conditions. The heel risers were a must! Easy to engage and stow. Love my snowshoes!
review.name: Best snowshoes for Denali and Alpine Mountaineering

review.reviewBody: I've used these twice so far and overall am very happy with my purchase. The heel lift bar is a must-have, the traction is great, they feel super durable, and they definitely stay in place. The only thing left to be desired is the straps. Other shoes have a boa system which is more convenient than these straps, but it's really just an issue of convenience and nothing else. Nothing wrong with them, but could be better, that's all.
review.name: Nearly perfect

review.reviewBody: Sorry, I cannot answer any questions because I gave them as a Christmas gift to my son—-- which was very well received. If he has any comments or problems, I’ll let you know if you send more surveys.
review.name: Not in my possession

review.reviewBody: These are the best snowshoes. Slim so you don’t catch them on eachother. Super light weight. The cost is a Great price. Very durable. Easy to grab and get after it. I went for an all day trip in the mountains with there. One downside is the straps sometimes fall off but it’s a very minor issue
review.name: The best snowshoes

review.reviewBody: These shoes do not work with men's boot sizes 14 and above - more so if you wear a wide size. The boot toe box is too wide to pass through the opening preventing the mechanics of the shoe to work properly.
review.name: Caution Large or Wide Boot Sizes

review.reviewBody: I have used them on 4 Adirondack High Peaks Hikes, There great!
review.name: I have used them on

review.reviewBody: As someone who wears a size 15 winter boot this is the ONLY pair of snowshoes that I could find that fit. It just so happens that they work really well.
review.name: Bryan

review.reviewBody: Bought these to replace a pair that broke. Would liked to have gotten replacement parts but MSR never returned inquires for spare parts via the website.
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: Before buying please read the reviews for the replacement straps. You have been warned!
review.name: Strap issues

review.reviewBody: These are great snowshoes. Very versatile and durable and can handle everything from casual hikes on flat terrain to relatively technical steep terrain (I'm located in the Rocky Mtns). I see some people have issues with the bindings, but I think they work great. They are easy to snug up and I've never had any comfort or retention issues. I carry an extra strap on me in the event one snaps. They also have the ability to be field repaired better than other snowshoes (the televator bail can be used in the event one of the binding pins breaks at the decking). I'm close to 200 lbs. and run them as-is with no tails and they still have decent flotation, even in the dry Colorado snowpack. I highly recommend them.
review.name: Great snowshoe! Durable and Versatile

name: Evo Ascent Snowshoe - Men's

description: Buy the Burley Coho Pannier Trailer Rack online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Coho Pannier Trailer Rack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Coho Pannier Trailer Rack online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Was a great addition to trailer! I had a little problem with the setup had an alignment problem that ended up popping a rivet nut on the trailer but still worth 5stars just be careful on mounting !
review.name: Nice addition

review.reviewBody: So far rack has worked out great. Easy install. Definitely changed the way trailer handled. Been using trailer for about a year. Didn’t think it would have changed handling that much. Just thinking I need to get used to it and make sure bags are loaded evenly.
review.name: Handling

review.reviewBody: Totally worth it! Adds more options and room to my outdoor adventures! 👍
review.name: Saddle bags

review.reviewBody: I bought this rack to have a little extra capacity which it provides nicely with the Burley Panniers. It appears to be well made but it wasn't as easy to install as the video makes it look. I had to tweak it to install since it didn't line up perfectly with the mounting points.. Once it is installed the no tool fold up of the Coho goes away. You have to use the allen wrench to remove it before you can break down the Coho for storage/travel.
review.name: Extra Carrying Capacity

review.reviewBody: The rack gives you the ability to carry more gear or whatever when you need to. It mounts easily and appears very sturdy. Time will will tell but so far so good.
review.name: Extra space when you need it

review.reviewBody: Its made of solid aluminum rod so its strong and light. It bolted right up with no troubles. I did however replace the bolts with stainless steel M5's. Oh and I use Ortlieb front panniers for a perfect fit and to match my kit.
review.name: Awesome add on.

review.reviewBody:
Just got my Coho trailer yesterday as well as the rack. It seems very well constructed, and attaches easily and solidly to the trailer frame.
However, the allen-head screw heads (utilizing a 3mm allen wrench) are easily stripped when tightening to a normal tightness. It's the head that is stripping, not the threads. I tried with two different relatively new 3mm allen wrenches. On my other bikes that I've attached racks to (including a mountain bike, touring bike, fat bike, tandem and a custom 4 seat quad bicycle) I *think* the screws were stainless and I've never had an issue. But I'm also aware of the cautions of using differing metals due to galvanic corrosion (the pannier racks are made of aluminum) but in one case I've had aluminum racks with stainless screws attached now for almost 30 years (!) with no issues...maybe I'll replace the Burley-supplied screws with stainless?
Regardless, I'm quite satisfied with the trailer so far and am looking forward to using it with the attached pannier rack in the backcountry!
review.name: Great rack, but allen heads easily strip

name: Coho Pannier Trailer Rack

review.reviewBody:
This think jacket is incredibly versatile and really gets the job done. I haven't worn it in the rain yet, but it does a great job as a wind breaker.   I wore it today on a 50F degree  road ride with just a thin thermal long sleeve under it.  I consider it a solid investment.
Very comfortable as well.  Rolls up nicely for pocket storage, if you don't need it. For reference, I'm 44" chest, 34" waist in the US Large (which I believe is XL in Euro sizing).   Fireball is a visible but cool color.  Not red and not orange.
review.name: this is a great piece of gear

review.reviewBody: My favourite trait in the Torrent Cycling Jacket are the long sleeves. This includes a thoughtful short extension on the back of the hand which helps to position the sleeve over a glove. Thanks to the stretch material and great cut, I have great arm and shoulder mobility, unlike in most other jackets that I have tested. The unconstrained range of motion also helps to reach the zipped back pocket which can easily hold a mobile phone. Moving the pocket’s zip is a bit fiddly though while on the go despite the support cord. The front zip on the other hand responds rather well and tucks neatly into the zip garage of the fleece-lined collar.
review.name: A fabulous companion

name: Torrent Cycling Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Love these! The fabric is waterproof when precip is falling, the hook and adjustable hem are nice features so they dan be worn without gaiters. Extra durable fabric on the butt makes for fast and easy glissading! Felt insulated for the gliss too but they did get wet during 3000’ of glissading. They do dry fast though!

Cons: pockets are tight for a standard iphone, turn inside out when it’s removed, and it’s hard to get your phone back in. Also, they hit RIGHT where my harness does!
review.name: Great pants, pockets need work

review.reviewBody: Mammut women's trousers are valued for their high quality and functionality, they are ideal for outdoor activities, such as mountain hiking. Made of durable materials, they often have a GORE-TEX membrane that provides protection against rain and wind. The design and ergonomic cut usually guarantee comfort and freedom of movement. Useful details such as ventilation and numerous pockets make Mammut trousers a practical choice for mountain hikers.
review.name: trousers for trips

review.reviewBody: These have become my go to alpine rock pants, and I've even used them with a base layer underneath for cross country skiing.  They are tough enough to survive granite, and the reinforced material on the bum and kick patches makes them extra durable.  The stretch is great for climbing/movement.   Pricier pants, but worth the cost in terms of multi-sport usage & durability.  Sizing is a bit small, so recommendation is to size up.

Been searching for years for a new go-to softshell that fits my muscular legs and bottom and still allows the pants to stretch. This is it! The integrated waist belt also cinches up easily and doesn't irritate my hips with a heavy pack. The pockets are harness compatible and fit a phone fairly easily. So far they've stood up to decent glacier wear and tear and look good doing it! Good midweight softshell for stand-alone climbing or use with a baselayer on colder peaks.
review.name: Softshell for ladies with muscle!

review.reviewBody: Worn rock climbing and scrambling around snowy peaks in the North Cascades. Comfortable, no shifting, three large pockets. Durable and very functional. I even received compliments from other hikers. Because I'm so tall, I wish these were a tiny bit longer, but they still reached the top of my boots without absurd high-watering. If you're of average height, these will fit great. So stretchy!
review.name: Awesome pants!

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'4 and normally between a size 4 size 6 pant depending on brands and often opt for short sizes. My thigh and butt muscles are pretty strong so sometimes the pant sizes vary to accommodate my build. I got a size 6 regular length bc they were out of short sizes. I also figured I may want to layer over a base layer. When I got the pants the length was great and they looked pretty cool. I was a little concerned they would be too tight but they are so stretchy I was easily and comfortable able to layer over a thinner wool base layer. The length worked great with my mountaineering boots and crampons. Took them out for some self arrest practice on some snow in the mountains this week- super easy to move in, dried very quickly and did not wet out. I even poked myself with the ice axe- got a small scratch on my leg but somehow no hole in my actual pant!
review.name: Comfy stretchy softshell pants

review.reviewBody: Really like the material. Windproof, waterproof and breathable fabric at the back. They are also very stretchy. The waist is true to size and has adjustable velcro on the sides. The shape is very becoming. They fit true to size (waist 26", hips 34", butt 36") The trift long tights fit underneath it nicely. I would need the size up to fit a thicker base layer. I am also excited to try these in the spring rock climbing.
review.name: Great for Nordic Skiing

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'0 105lbs and curvy, and the 4 Short fit perfect. I wish all companies would do different lengths. I've owned the Patagonia Simul Alpine (too thick and poor waistband) and the Arcteryx Gamma LT (too thin, loud swishy, and not soft). These win! You pay extra for the Schoeller (TM) material, but worth it. Soft, comfortable, flattering. SO stretchy, and I hope it's durable. Might use sparingly to prolong life. Will use for cold alpine climbing, climbing in inclement weather, and ski touring in >35 F temps.
review.name: Favorite softshell for alpine climbing

review.reviewBody: I want to love these pants more than I do. I love the bottom ankle closure having multiple options depending on your boots, the pockets have perfect placements and are nice and sizeable, the extra knee fabric and patterns are technical and fantastic. However, the waist closure sucks if you have an athletic (larger) butt and a small waist. This means that the front of the pants ride down and the closure strap rides above it. Really frustrating, but minor. Also, after climbing in these 20x, the fabric has started to pill and the triangle texture patches around the knees are peeling off. The mens version seems to be holding its durability and function better, which is disappointing.
review.name: Excessive waist size, some pilling

review.reviewBody: The quality of the material is excellent.  Very durable and the inside against skin is so comfortable.  The way the belt attaches and adjusts is perfect, very streamlined.  The thigh zippered pocket is just right for holding a cell phone, ID, or small map.  Been using in 40 degree windy, wet conditions and they perform excellent.  I will be purchasing a second pair for certain.
review.name: My new favorite pants

name: Courmayeur SO Pant - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Lizard Skins DSP Race 1.8mm Bar Tape online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really like the feel of this tape. It's supple, has a nice grippy feel and I like that it comes in all sorts of colors. It's durable and pretty easy to keep clean as well. The company stresses not stretching the tape so the first time used it I wrapped the bars way to lose and the result was terrible so wrap the bars tight but not super tight?? You'll know you're wrapping to lose if the tape feels like it's not gripping the bars and starts to come undone under the hoods. Once I figured out the right amount of tension to wrap the bars the results have been great.
review.name: Very comfy tape
comment: John, I use the same tape and I feel the 'stretching warning' more applies to the thicker tape, 2.5 and 3.2, but with the thinner 1.8 V2 I wrap pretty tight w/o issues.  I will note, I practiced for about 30 mins using the old Lizard Skin tape I was replacing to get the tension just right and viola, perfection.  I like the Lizard Skin tape above the others because I choose to ride w/o gloves (I have done so since I was a kid, sponsors hated me) and this tape feels great even when sweaty.  Cheers!

name: DSP Race 1.8mm Bar Tape

review.reviewBody: Hoped these shoes would fit as they came up when I searched for wide road bike shoes. Ordered a size up from what I would wear according to the size chart.  I could barely get my foot in the shoe.  Very disappointing.  I sent them back, and did get a refund, minus the return shipping.  I normally wear a Women's 7.5
review.name: small, narrow, could not wear
